BqMMk-zXcBG_W0ze8qn6Ug.text: This place has such amazing food. Flavors are on the spot. Just brilliant. The dishes are also nice and big also, so don't have to worry about getting your moneys worth. It has a very earthy feel to it also, with plants hanging all over the ceiling. HOWEVER, be prepared to wait during peak hours. I went at 3pm once--it was half full. 7pm--COMPLETELY PACKED. I asked how long it would be before I would get a table for two: 3 hours. There are two separate parts of the pub though. One for drinks and one for sitting down and eating. (Although you can eat at the bar also.) It just depends on what you're looking for. I guess while you're waiting you can go have a couple of drinks? Go for the food though! The pad thai and drunken noodle we had were both delish. (:

zrkSCk3gYGRAg6W-RxJoQA.text: Pub on the bottom (game machine and all)Thai on topKind of like a warped version of a mullet... if you see where I'm going there.Nice Thai food. White linened tables, flowers, attentive service. Good atmosphere at the pub with plenty of brews.Wifi code en route to the stairs.Shrug.

Jyp1Pi_p9zYaFZx8m1_FgA.text: All the positives from my last review still apply but felt compelled to lop a star off following a second visit, this time for lunch. It's hard to give 5 stars with the 1 hour table rule, even when the place isn't full with the bill plonked down after 45 mins without even asking for it. So just keep that in mind when you plan your visit, OK!

7h2CdJYniYp64tsK1VvHZg.text: This pub/restaurant was recommended by a good friend and a guide book.  This was my family's first visit to London (my 5th visit), and we were typical Americans.  We wanted the ambience of an English pub, but we wanted a step up in cuisine.  Voila!  The Churchill Arms.  After a long day of walking, my wife and I were ready for a cold one.  We were not disappointed as Churchill Arms had pints of ice cold Stella Artois!  The thai food was very good, adequate portions, and it was an interesting mix of English pub and ethnic cuisine.  Couldn't go wrong with that.  Even the kids (daughter 18 and son 16) enjoyed the Thai cuisine.  While we're certainly not experts in authentic Thai cuisine, we live in Orange County CA, we do know good food when we eat it.  The chicken yellow curry and egg rolls were very good.I highly recommend this pub/restaurant for American families wanting to try something different....

ymm7F5Vt8XsXG8sopJgh5A.text: This place has a lot of character. We stopped by for lunch and it was like eating in a florist shop. Food was good, generous portions and reasonably priced. We will be back if we are again in the area. Next time we'll check out the pub and have a pint!

iiR8--8Up6OSCH1TH9eSaw.text: Sure it may be a little warm in there and quite packed most of the time, but it remains On my way of London's finest traditional pubs. Was also the first pub I ever drank a pint at whilst in London ! I will miss this place. Place will remain - I'm returning to Montreal ! And Thai food served in the back of the pub is just fine / great prices too!!!

q-y8AvRAvHyZhuCiRvYoHQ.text: It's a garden really, outside is full of smokers drinking at the curb right next to the beautiful flowers and if you go for food (Thai food that is) you will be dining under a fresh canopy. The pub serves the usual suspects (Pride, Chiswick, ESB...) and the resto offers tasty Thai picks. Quite affordable (8 pounds a plate) BUT here is the bad thing: they give you exactly 60 minutes to sit, order, wait for food and eat. Beware slow eaters! You will be rushed out politely! Oh! And if you have left overs or didn't manage to eat your food you can have a box for take out after paying 50p

5fZBHIUe5alajoL6uR_6wg.text: Main Idea:Authentic and historic pub AND awesome Thai food in the back.Pros:Cheap food (starters: ~2 to 14; mains: ~10-12) and drinks Beautiful atmosphere (bar and restaurant) and outdoor patioCons:Extremely busy/crowded - but that's quite often a sign of a place you want to be.One hour seating limit in the restaurant - no lingering. Back to the bar people!

dlm1CnwKgwZMcQ3LG796vA.text: O.M.G.A friend and I watched a movie close by and we were looking for this particular pub. It was so cold we nearly gave up but suddenly we saw a burst of flowers (seriously the whole building is covered in potted plants).It was packed, it took about 35 mins to get a table but we were quite happy to have a drink and wait. We weren't disappointed - I had the spicy pad thai and it was amazing! So many flavours, the portion was huge but i somehow managed to finish it - although this meant waddling to the tube later on full to bursting.The thing that made it for me was the decor - there were plants hanging from the ceiling and even the loo was full of pretty potted flowers. Kinda like a pretty english flower jungle. Def recommend it for great food and strange surroundings.

FYR934v3IPQ_e5Zxw8fK1w.text: Found this out-of-the-way gem on Yelp. Spring Rolls are excellent. Pad Thai also excellent. Very cool and unique atmosphere   Don't let the British Pub in front fool you.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom

bVcRNkH5q43m0JmwFLFqDw.text: Brilliant indoors and out, food is great.  Wish they had T-shirts that I could take to my friends in the USA rather than the London tourist shirts at Covent Garden!

1W7G1GSH_AgSP1KuxymOSw.text: I never thought I'd experience a Thai version of Chef-Boy-R-Dee but, here we are. We went to the Churchill Arms this afternoon after reading all the glowing Yelp reviews. We were, sadly, greatly disappointed with the mediocre fare we received. We had the pork Pad Thai and the stir fried pork with vegetables. Overall, the flavor was weak, the sauces were thin, the meat was tough and over cooked and, screw it...It was just bottom of the barrel crap. I can't understand how people are saying this is 5 star Thai food, unless we happened to be there on an off day.The place is fairly cheap for London, but you get what you pay for.

pY89vQzGAWQL3W2GXYR18w.text: Loved the chicken red curry. Thai basil-kaprow was nice, more basil would have been nice. Very cute inside and out. Sad I found it on my last day in London. Staff was pleasant. No Thai tea, I asked.

knsaC6oTukyge5DaHQEYfA.text: Bit of an institution this place. It's a Fuller's pub so the beer range is limited. But the flowery exterior makes this one of the most recognizable pubs in London. Worth a visit, but not a long one.

_bH1KRe1S9TbplCYwJCjIg.text: Great food and a great ambience! Watch out if you have pollen allergies. There are a lot of flowers in the back room.

JpuP5CeK404nun33bilHsA.text: An excellent pub with, strangely enough, a great casual Thai restaurant in the back.

TB5iGOlT_x-Dgilf4jsy3g.text: I probably can't add much to what all the great reviews have already covered. I was not expecting great Thai food in an old pub. The pub itself is a reason to visit, the cozy atmosphere enhanced by greenery everywhere. And I mean everywhere. How the heck do they water all those plants? And the icing on the cake is that you get a large portion of food for a reasonable price. There were 3 of us eating dinner and we all ordered different dishes. I sampled them all and would have a hard time ordering next time because everything was so good. My stepmom is Thai and I know what good Thai food tastes like. Of course you can find better Thai food in Thailand or in fancier restaurants but I think you won't find better in a pub. Run, do not walk, and get you some crazy good Thai food!

FhgoI7zTuGHyQpF-bAZV5A.text: I don't get all the fuss. The service bordered on just plain bad, as we were rushed from the moment we sat down by numerous waiters so they could turn over the table. The food was nothing special. I've had much better Thai food elsewhere. The exterior of the pub is about the only thing that makes this place charming. Wouldn't go back.

1BoStEtjmhlncxodssmEmg.text: An eclectic experience as the restaurant is tucked in the back of a pub. Loved the Pad Thai. Not to be missed. Affordable too. Beware. This restaurant likes quick eating and will be prone to push you out quickly.

LQMHnb2qvI5yMzqra0NoTQ.text: Great British Pub with a twist.......A restaurant at the rear which serves fresh cooked Thai food!Quality of the food,for a pub restaurant is very good indeed,and the ambiance of the restaurant,is great fun.Visited this great pub on numerous occasions,both to eat & just for a pint of very well kept ale.Would recommend to anyone (with one proviso),they have to be patient,this is a BUSY place,although the staff work "flat out" to serve you as quickly as they can.If you want a quiet pub to sit and contemplate,then this is NOT the place for you,as it gets incredibly busy and space is very much at a premium in the bar area.Give it a go,you won't be disappointed.

OrRMBKj5hvZHaqnqvKcpWA.text: Earlier in our trip we had Thai food at Rosa's and it was so phenomenal that we wanted Thai food again before leaving. Did a quick Yelp search and this place popped up. Pub + Thai? Yes please. We made a reservation just in case and glad we did. It was packed. Good beer selection which we partook in. Beer came out quickly as well as food. We ordered chicken pad Thai and a beef red curry. Both were good, but not great. We asked for a way to make it spicier and they provided red pepper flakes and some sort of liquid chili sauce. Delicious after that addition. Added just the perfect amount of spice. Noise level was about average.

pQ9GS9GREydfiPaJs_3JfQ.text: First "Thai Pub" I have ever been to. This place was located in a residential are of Notting Hill. It was not too far from Hyde Park. We went there for dinner on our last night in central London after spending an evening walking  the Hyde Park.Had Chicken Fried Rice and Green Curry, along with some Beer and wine. Food was ok, but the ambience was great.

jhUnGiU9IBjtLlGwYpxROA.text: Very reasonable and very charming pub/Thai restaurant.  So homey and wonderful decor.  The food was not fancy (in fact, it wasn't much better than okay) but still, it was a fun place to drop in for drinks and an informal dinner with friends.  We had a good time.

pFbYLSYW10_gsG4In_ikAg.text: The Churchill is something of a London institution on the pub scene. It's an odd mixture of British, Irish and Thai and yet somehow it works. As most of the reviews mention, the outside is bedecked by flowers. The inside is equally cluttered with tankards, flags, chamber pots, Winston Churchill paraphernalia and Irish souvenirs. It all adds up to a very quirky environment.Essentially though, it is a London pub and a fine one at that. It carries the Fullers range of beers plus a fully stocked bar. Many people gravitate here for the Thai food but as I've not eaten here, I can't comment on that.Gerry is a big character landlord who is happy to chat to the customers. At the time of writing, he appears to be canvassing votes for the VisitEngland Tourism Superstar 2015 awards!A popular draw for tourists and Londoners alike.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Fullers ales in tip top condition

9M2CW9dR593CC-9l996Azw.text: One of our best meals in London was at The Churchill Arms.  We arrived around 7pm and the bar and restaurant were packed so we put our name in with the receptionist for an 8pm table.  To kill time we ordered some English beer and hard cider at the bar and went outside to stand amongst the locals.  The wait wasn't too bad since we had good beverages and good company!The Thai food is absolutely amazing at The Churchill Arms!  We started off our meal with spring rolls and shrimp chips.  For entrees we ordered the Chicken Pad Thai, Green Curry Chicken and Pad Gai Himmapan.  The portions are huge, the prices are inexpensive, and the food is delicious.  What more could you ask for?  Friendlier service?  The service was was friendly enough and our food and drinks arrived promptly despite the restaurant being so busy.Because this place does get packed there is a one hour limit at the tables.  Eat your food, pay the bill, and grab some drinks at the bar if you want to linger longer!

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Pad Gai Himmapan
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Pad Thai
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Shrimp Chips and Spring Rolls

ryUt9fzX1CqYeMPJF2_6aA.text: You have to go just to see the flowers everywhere. The atmosphere is something we've never seen before. Thai food restaurant was fantastic!!!! Waitress attitude was so-so, but worth it 100%.

03VtEdlxnmaVQaEoTUlozg.text: Fun place with lots of kitch hanging all over the walls and ceiling.  Standard pub beers, but with Thai food offered!  Great location.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom

zd9vv5rgtkrSpe7YJv-UFg.text: I am in love with this place! Very charming classic British pub, with an incredible Thai kitchen in the back!?!? What an amazing, random combination! The Thai food was some of the best I have yet had London. Simple menu, with just enough choices. It also clearly rates the spiciness of each dish with a pepper symbol- and the threepepper dishes are VERY SPICY!! It was amazing! So many Thai places tone down dishes for westerners, but not this place. Only order the three peppers if you know you can handle it. I was pushed to the brink of my spice tolerance, yum yum yum. Can't wait to return.

gFXrP8AR8xUEaJxm4QrKGA.text: Food was unbelievably good! However, unfortunately the service was extremely bad! I went with my wife and got the chicken pad thai, which I highly recommend if you decide to go. The server treated us as if they were doing us a huge favor.. not sure what training they received, but the owner certainly needs to review his staff/training, especially in the Thai section of the restaurant. Guest satisfaction always needs to be top priority.. keep that in mind.

SyHwWH4RLiZW5Hq6iCNaYQ.text: If you're a visitor (llke me) and looking for an authentic pub experience, check out the Churchill Arms if in the area.Firstly it's covered in flowers and flags.Inside, the scene is just as festive.  There are hundreds of historic items hanging from the ceiling and walls adorned with posters of Sir WInston and others.  The staff were nice as well as the regulars.  My only regret is that I had just eaten somewhere else and couldn't try the Thai Food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom

Zq-JaFBa43mJH6xiE-Ts_w.text: This place is amazing! Atmosphere is very bustling, but definitely enjoyable. The inside of the pub is decorated with flags, pots and pans, flowers, and virtually everything you can imagine. The food itself is delicious authentic Thai, which was a pleasant surprise to us.I would highly recommend this pub if you are a local, but especially if you are a visitor to the U.K.

cXK4lYCLSfGexAcHXnPhEw.text: This is an absolute must if you are visiting London. My fiancé and I stumbled upon The Churchill Arms on our final day in London and I am so glad we did. The outside is incredibly picturesque -- bursting at the seams with flowers and flags galore. You walk inside and are greeted by a traditional British pub, but it won't be long before you start smelling the incredibly curries and other Thai flavors. Wander to the right of the bar and you'll find yourself in a beautiful oasis full of flowers upon flowers and a sit down Thai restaurant. (Don't worry, you can still order drinks from the pub -- we took advantage of that!) The spring rolls, pad see ew, and red curry were phenomenal. The perfect of amount of spice and the rice was cooked just perfectly! This is definitely a spot I will be making sure to visit every time I find myself in London!TIP: Avoid the need to make a reservation and grab lunch instead! We had no wait and the food was on our table within 10 minutes of ordering!

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. The beautiful Churchill Arms!
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Spring rolls, pad see ew, red curry, a Guinness and a Staropramen -- yum!!
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Inside the back dining room at The Churchill Arms.

WPtnuAGuVpNnSVVFrKLDKA.text: The Churchill Arms is truely a hidden gem in London. Our friends led us to the pub for Thai, which we thought was a touch strange. There is absolutely no way of knowing there is even a restaurant in there.Initially we were turned away for dinner as the restaurant out the back of the bar was full, however we insisted we had to eat here, so they reluctantly accommodated us in the bar.I'm so pleased they did. It is seriously the best Thai I have had outside of Thailand. The duck curry is absolutely out of this world and the pad thai is perfection! Not only that it's really cheap too. Nothing like great food that is easy on the wallet.The service however, is absolutely shocking! The owner/manager is rude and abrasive, but it's worth putting up with for the amazing food.We will definitely be dining there again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom

jw_qM40EPRsCKoo_qRBJ8w.text: You have to come here with the right expectations. Most of the bad reviews are not about the food, but about the service. And most of the service reviews are about being told, often more than once, that you have ONE HOUR to eat. So, if that already bothers you, or if getting the bill placed on the table without asking (normal in the U.S., rare in the U.K.) don't go, you won't enjoy it.The restaurant is decent looking. Not a particularly romantic spot, but a fun friends spot. The pub is bustling, and the flowers everywhere is a sight to behold.My G/f got the Pad Thai with shrimp. Tasty, not outstanding, but much better once she asked for some chili oil. I got the Pad Kee Mao noodle dish with the three heat symbols, with the mix of meats. The heat was fairly intense, and this coming from someone who always gets Madras hot, and sometimes Vindaloo at the Indian. I'd put the heat up there near Vindaloo, but, for me at least, absolutely perfect, with a little burn, but not unpleasant. And most importantly, it didn't overpower the flavours of the dish, which were outstanding. I think the chef knows a thing or two. One of the best plates of food I've ever eaten. Yes, that good. And a bargain at £8.50 for a big plate of food.The service was fast, fairly friendly, and the food came quickly. If we'd had appetizers (really limited choice, one being six very tasty looking fried egg rolls for £4.50 I think, but we weren't hungry enough) then we would have been pushing close to that one hour limit, but with just the main we were done with no rush. I don't think they will bother you unless you are done, and then sit with your drinks, then they'll want you to give someone else a chance at this amazing food.Book ahead and prepare for tasty.

Kp7Uq_3d4WBKphaD-HrtKg.text: It's a must stop in London. British beer and thai food! Holy crap, so good.  We had an english cask pint with spring rolls after a red eye flight coming from the USA.  It was perfect.

mB_HlymsI-2QtOy1FM1U0A.text: If you're searching for "American" Asian cuisine then you've found it here. It's an Irish/English pub as you walk in where you can enjoy a nice Guinness and await a table for the restaurant in the back that serves Thai food. As we walked in the back towards the restaurant we were greeted by several very friendly women servers; one in which immediately stretched out her arms for my 16 month old son to come to her. My son must have sensed her warm personality and went straight to her. She took him to the flower garden and showed him the fish and flowers as my husband and I got situated in at a table. We ordered spring rolls to start which were amazing. Very light and not oily at all. We then each ordered a Thai dish that had red and green peppers, onions, spring onions, as well as a choice of chicken, pork, or prawns. I opted for cashews in addition and spicy. Both came with white rice and were a perfect portion. It was extremely tasty, as well as, making me feel at home as it made me feel like excellent Chinese take out from home (NY). I would definitely recommend this place and we will definitely be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom

dL2XRyQ5Q-2RXxN9YdFzSw.text: A Thai restaurant inside a beautiful old English pub? I was sold! Upon arriving at the Churchill arms I was really impressed with the flower display and couldn't wait to go inside and sample the food. The interior is also quite a spectacle; there is a somewhat eccentric mix of British bric-a-brac, Irish memorabilia and flowers.The food prices are very reasonable for London. For £8.50 I got a large portion of rice with some vegetarian jungle curry. There was no tofu, which was a bit of a let down, but the food was okay. It was far from being the best Thai food in London, but really you are paying for the beautiful location.I would happily come back for a drink, or just to stare at the building from outside.

RPe1CkL8k1qGFsv7WmAyqQ.text: The Churchill Arms: Pub, 5 stars every time... Thai Restaurant, 3 stars but would return for sure...   We have been a few times for the pub side of The Churchill Arms but this visit was our first Thai Restaurant visit. The Pub is just fanatic, quirky, British, fun, a good selection of Ales. Service quick and pleasant, as it has been on previous visits. 5 stars for the pub side... we love it....The Thai Restaurant part I knew of its reputation and its didn't disappoint. Running late with our table, and at the end of our meal being chased off it sharpish. Food is very good, and there is a good selection to choose from, maybe a little research beforehand as the staff are not too helpful with explaining about certain dishes as one of our guests found out. The wine took a while, and we should have grabbed a bottle from the pub side beforehand, as we had got well into our starters before it came. It's a 3 star, but I would eat there again as it is an experience and with the right group of friends can be very amusing as we found it. The Thai staff there are sharp, not rude but they will do their thing - their way.... maybe that's why people return to the scene of the crime.... we would, and it's NON-halal according to James who works there, so a plus for us.

mTldqAUCRzvCDNqeVudzug.text: Cool place with a relatively mixed crowd. Gets rather busy and due to it's set up, this can be rather annoying. Trendy decor with a warm atmosphere, ideal for winter nights.

AWo6pUO-VHFN4LPefYzrcw.text: Very good pub, moderately interesting restaurant.I like this place for a beer. Loud, good selection of beers, beautifully covered with flowers outside in a nice neighborhood. When it comes to the restaurant though I have mixed feelings. On one hand the food is ok, but as you have limited time to spend at the table you might del little uncomfortable being nagged by the waitress that your time is up. So not a good place for a relaxed dinner or lunch. Not my type...

okNWS2kz4VNeI53Fdj1Rmg.text: In my experience this is the best pub in London. Run for many years by a friendly and gregarious Irish landlord it has all that you could want from a traditional pub: good beer, excellent food (Thai), and a marvellous atmosphere at any time of the day or night. Pubs where you can walk in and feel immediately comfortable and at home are quite rare but that is the case with the Churchill, whether you are a tourist or a local. I am lucky enough to be the latter and whilst not a frequent pubgoer I am a regular visitor here. Outside in the Spring and Summer, the floral display is worth the visit alone and the greenhouse restaurant inside serves extremely tasty and amazingly good value Thai food. The bar staff are friendly and efficient and one end of the bar is dedicated to sports on the TV and this is a fun place to watch a major event. Only downside - it is usually crowded because many obviously feel as I do. Hats off the landlord - his infectious sociability sets the mood. If only all pubs were like this.

_GcLwdCWBp09w81xhLDQjw.text: In town visiting from the US.  A nice walk from the hotel and very pleased when I arrived.  Very nicely decorated with a nice aura inside.  Friendly barkeeps and delicious thai in the back.  Definately recommend checking it out.  Nice pub.

-Pa45cef2SYpvEgV-MUsqg.text: Traditional pub with line of ales on tap.very friendly staff. but too busy in afternoon.

VxuxL1qCQTXFnxpapBULtw.text: I adore this place. The coziness when you walk into the front pub, the bizarre hanging plants when you enter the back area for cheap curries and pad thai. I used to scurry over here on rainy/snowy days, order the most spice-filled thing on the menu and then scurry home toasty warm! Great place to grab food and not empty your wallet.

JD3JhkPBKxhyWQdpf5eZxw.text: This place is great. A good old boozer in Kensington/Notting Hill. Loads of stuff hanging from the ceiling and the regular, reliable Fuller's beer on tap. The Thai at the back is always good in a cafe sort of way, good value. No garden.

giJ0HDm7BtcRvEUfYCzCww.text: such a pity. its way more appealing from the outside. the food is cheap, but the service is nasty. in the restaurant at the back, you are constantly reminded that you only have 90minutes to eat and leave. fine, get on a darned well serve me then!! the pad thai is fine, but exceptionally stingy with prawns (3?!!!) so knowing this, my friend asked for additional prawns (which she'd pay for) to which she was flatly told no. They then brought the bill whilst we were still eating (and had 20mins of our 90 left) then returned every 2 minutes asking for payment.i will not be going back a third time.

OvC9Z5C0LGok3ZUQUzxbaw.text: If you're looking for a real, classic english pub, but also a very handy and nice location, then this is the one you should be heading to. The experience of Churchill Arms starts with what can be seen outside. A beautiful house in a corner of Notting Hill that looks almost made of tree leaves and flowers welcomes you in a very particular way. Inside, the environment is special and different from the rest of the pubs I have ever visited in the city. Very nice and high class looking people, no lousy drunks, no music, but still very funny. All the way down you get the restaurant section with a spillover of flowers and green, which is a nice touch. And a very very good thai food for a really good price (mains for less than 7 pounds). I don't give the place 5 stars just because of the service in the restaurant which can be very much improved.

pUpr5R9HVuJ-aCPxwwgsGQ.text: Fuller's best pub, great beer, great food, the best collection of chamber pots and butterflies in the World.

ndcbkzL4pfwLI3RZq2AX4Q.text: Unglaublich: Ausgezeichnete Thai-Küche in und unter einem Blumenmeer in einem historischen Pub. Wir hatten Padthai mit Shrimps & Chicken - einfach ein Traum. Grosse Auswahl an Bieren.

QyszTIAFUHNiOx0VbJ9rmg.text: A mighty fine boozer with a great atmosphere. If I was directing a tourist to a traditional english pub this could potentially fit the bill. Decent selection of drinks, and not at all expensive. Worth going to, and it shows the sport too but in a none offensive way.

NB7NlaIem_vYLjS-marlAw.text: This pub seems to be most famous for its wonderful display of flowers surrounding it. But for me, this pub is so much more. As well as friendly bar staff, and a great atmosphere for having a drink with friends, the thai food in this place is wonderful. Not many people think that a pub would have good thai food, but this pub serves only the best. Delicious food, great drinks and great atmosphere.

ezMXr9TYBUT8DSA-h7YVFg.text: Wonderfully British institution, best visited in summer to get the full view of its amazing flower baskets that hang all over the outside, a definite stop for tourists walking through the area. Great atmospheric interior, lots of hanging Churchill-related memorabilia and friendly bar staff, with well priced drinks. Very eccentric. The highlight for me, however, is the Thai restaurant that joins itit's one of my favourites in London and I regularly make the pilgrimage West just to go here. Incredibly well priced dishes (around £6 each) and quick service with big portions. They also offer a take-away service and you can call ahead to order. Highly recommended.

mNS0Y-w1y1dZfgEZDL4-6w.text: Hmm did I die and go to heaven? So I think that statement may be a bit too extreme for those who live in London, but this is coming from an American where the concept of an original English pub that serves good Thai food is totally out of the question. This venue is half English pub, half Thai food restaurant with a clean restroom to boot. While I was here, I had the most spicy pad kree mao with a pint of beer  - several different kinds in fact that went very well with my food. And when it says very spicy on the menu, they really mean it. I am pretty good with spicy food and favor it, but I had to take a pause after maybe 5-6 bites so that my ears would stop burning. All this while at the same time every time I glanced up, my eyes would meet Winston Churchill's. It was strange at first, but then he started to resemble someone who would actually listen to my problems and have some sort of solution to it. I was probably drinking a bit too much at this point. Well, I'd love to go back to this place again and again, but sadly I'm just a piddly little foreigner here. However, while I was here, I had a great time speaking meaningful conversation with my husband, eating good spicy Thai food and downing pint after pint of beer. Cheers!!!

7ZtjZwj-bdeVJCWd0xv0Mg.text: It is a very expensive pub, that although pretty in cluttered sort of way, the staff are neither friendly or polite

mUbxr3DvKAZwMFle7bobIg.text: i really do enjoy this pub, the food, the price, atmosphere everything...and specially the chocolate cake..!!! my God..... _

3B-HJuMJpfVCfCY-yp0f1g.text: I used to love going to the Churchill Arms for a nice Thai but after my recent experience will not return. I recommended the restaurant to a friend organising her birthday meal in London. Our table of 14 was booked for 7.30pm on a Saturday. The group took its time to arrive as the Central Line was down, but everyone was ready to order by 7.55. Throughout the meal our food was almost thrown at us, whilst drinks orders took 40 minutes to appear (not great if you're eating a spicy curry!) Our plates were cleared whilst others had only just got their food. Our bill was brought (without being asked for it) whilst some of our party were still eating - I take it they don't offer desserts/coffee?! Then as soon as our credit cards had been charged they literally evicted us - moving chairs away whilst some of the party were still finishing their drinks! Appalling service. We ended up stood in the bar, catching our breath and finishing our drinks at 9.10pm. I understand that some restaurants in London 'turn tables', but even so - allowing only 1h40 for a group of 14 to have a 'celebratory' meal seems ridiculous. I was so embarrassed to have recommended the pub in the first place - in the end the birthday girl took it well and we ended up laughing at the Fawlty Towers approach...A nice atmospheric pub, with good value but 'nothing special' food and terrible service - you can do better.

i_7Cae9VJOg0lXq4gyMuqA.text: Good and inexpensive Thai food. Service in the pub is better than it is in the restaurant.

4LuMJqZ8V90D_GAYSYapgA.text: I thought this place is brilliant. It really doesn't get much better than this. But the I saw how much it was! Only joking. but seriously I would probably go there much more often if it was cheaper. However the food is great and you really can't fault with much. So yeh, a good place to eat.

uv7ZuAsgW5QmPk3KtVaEFA.text: The Churchill Arms is an institution. It combines a great British pub with a great Thai restaurant. Service is pretty fast, although you sometimes have to wait a while for a table. The green curry is excellent!

4wlNLswmbdSNO6fypf9EwA.text: Great pub, fantastic setting with masses of flower baskets in summer, beautiful dining area but bad food and service in the restaurant.

roMD04HPP5zVqZHK7UVbeA.text: great thai food, very authentic (and spicy). i think this place is affiliated in some way with addies in earls court, which is one of the best thai restauarants in london (and this place is also a pub)

ygWbfcjbUsgKdf5Nu0BGlg.text: My friend and I were in London for 6 days and ate here 3 times for dinner. I kind of wish I had eaten here every night, honestly. At the second visit the hostesses recognized me, and by the third they were willing to accommodate us even though they were fully booked (I think they were also on to us that, as Americans, we wouldn't linger all night long over our meal). Regardless of the fact that it was within walking distance of my hotel, it has absolutely the best Thai food in the world. IN THE WORLD. A lot of American restaurants have a serious issue serving truly spicy and authentic Thai food. Not this place. Our eyes and noses watered and we loved it.  I couldn't tell you exactly what we ordered, but I'm confident that all of their dishes are delicious. As for the actual pub . . . what a gem this place is.  Always crowded but always welcoming.  My friend only drinks cider beer, and she was not disappointed.  And the florals outside--oh my.  A sight to behold. This is a bright light tucked back in the sweetest little neighborhood. I want to be back in London for many reasons, but most of all to eat and drink at The Churchill Arms again.  Thank you for bring such a memorable part of my trip. Please visit if you have the opportunity!

wkALXMnnNAo2_ozt494MRg.text: The Churchill Arms is an exercise in brokering the modern bar with an extremely traditional British pub. You are surrounding with Churchill memorabilia that evokes a wonderful sense of yesteryear. The crowd is a full spectrum of young and not so young which makes it a good place to bring your friends (or your mom if so inclined.)There is an adjoining Thai restaurant with a friendly staff which you can order from and they deliver it right to your seat in the pub. As a lover of alcohol and Asian cuisine this place speaks to me on an existential level. Definitely check out their website; their email sign up includes a free drink.

ZMd57AC2Y6gGLtJEtoM8jw.text: The Churchill Arms is as good as it gets.  Apparently the first London pub to replace a traditional pub kitchen with an exciting Thai alternative = legend has it that Jerry met the original chef on one of his butterfly hunting trips.  You see the man himself less behind the bar these days, but the pub is just as buzzing as ever.   Actually, the Churchill Arms is a victim of its own success, it is way too busy.  It is impossible these days to just walk in and stand any hope of a table.  Too many raving reviews (this is another one, not that one's needed!) pack the place out with tourists from all over the world.  I wonder if any of the old regulars still pop in for their pint.  I hope so!The only chance you have is to book a table at the conservatory restaurant - highly recommended!

CPCs-PrhK6bEwwTlsHgsqQ.text: This is one of the best pubs I have been to in London! We were here to watch the England Vs. Slovakia Euo '16 match. So great atmosphere - check! Churchill Arms is all-out floral on the outside and extremely rustic on the inside. Don't think these guys believe in the middle path! The flowers outside bring out summer very charmingly. Inside, I love all the trinkets hung from floor to ceiling...wish I could buy some of them! I could just spend time staring at each of them and wondering what's the history behind each.They serve good Thai food and if you are sitting by the bar you can order just the spring rolls and prawn crackers.Must go if you are in the Notting Hill area.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom

P_zklksixdxJCFncTCJv6Q.text: Thai Restaurant Review!Well this was certainly an interesting experience. I read the reviews for this place extensively and despite the negative tones for the Thai restaurant, we decided to check it out simply because the exterior and interior of the bar is super cool.First off, you cannot make reservations online if you live outside the UK/EU. I tried and they sent me a denial email saying I had to call. Being that the restaurant highly suggests making reservations, I called England from the US on my dime. It was for my husband's birthday and I wanted to make sure we were guaranteed a spot. I called and the lady told me we'd only have the table for an hour and I agreed.When we arrived, the outside was really cool and the inside of the bar area was packed. We went to the back of the building to access the restaurant. HOLY HUMIDITY! In none of the reviews did I read how horribly miserable the atmosphere was in there. It was stifling. We were in and out within 30 minutes--between the temperature, humidity, hot food (review on that in a bit), it was totally unbearable. We were wiping sweat with our napkins. Now, we're from California and have spent summers on the east coast, so we're used to uncomfortably warm weather, but this was totally unacceptable for an eating establishment.As for the food, it was mediocre. It was NOT spicy (and I even ordered the supposedly 'spiciest' option). I think most of the reviewers who claim it's so wonderful must live in places that serve dreadful Thai food.So yeah, spending less than an hour here should be no problem because the service is quick and they basically hot-box you out with the temperature. As for the bar, even though the air was more tolerable, we bounced as fast as we could. Oh well :-/ Gave 2 stars only because of the aesthetics of the building.

2Xq096q0Jov_YENZ5XfLBQ.text: Having read the reviews thought our dinner may be rushed-1 hour limit at table made crystal clear as we entered restaurant. Fine. We were in the mood for Thai. Table was ample and menu items sounded good. Ordered 2 different curry dishes. Both were good. Wine was a "light" pour. Rather than being rushed had to summon waiter for water than for check. Maybe because it was a Wednesday night. Upon leaving, noticed people eating in pub. Pub seating far superior to the atmosphere in back as the hanging plants on ceiling were yellow and looked as if they were suffering. Would have preferred comfortable pub seat and a view of the bar. Overall, food ok to good but atmosphere lacking. Unless you are hankering for Thai food and nothing else will do, maybe stand outside under the beautiful foliage and have a pint instead.

NsRQ-h4vaFKtLwljhAGHxQ.text: THE prettiest pub I've ever seen! I'm kicking in 2 stars just for the beautiful foliage outside. We were meeting a friend there for a pint and pub was lively because of the Rugby finals on TV. Unfortunately for us, it was so lively that we weren't able to get a seat or attention from any of the servers for a table.I was looking forward to having a pint and Thai food but it was not meant to be. I'll give it another chance when I go back and hope that I won't have the same experience.

E_Uon_rFp9zL6zrzK_JsdA.text: Growth isn't always good. Haven't been here for years but the "get'em in get'em out" mentality is alive and well. The food was so so. No fish cake. (A go to for me).  Disappointed at best. The staff, however, is amazing and nice ...  and super quick. (Get'em out).

n5Asx4dDmGAIBGubt3gmFg.text: AMAZING Thai food. Seriously, the best sit down Thai in London. Small space, service isn't the best, but the food makes up for it. Such a fun atmosphere, with the garden look and butterfly theme. Again, service isn't fabulous...bring your own water, they aren't good at doing refills for you. A must visit for any Thai food fans in London.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Churchill and Arms-one of the restaurants I always visit whenever I go back to London!
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. ceiling of Churchill and Arms-I felt like I was in a butterfly fairy garden!

sC8m16u3dycNBuxWPFYROA.text: After dinner we were ready to go to our first pub! Since we were staying Notting Hill, we wanted to go to a local pub. We did a bit of searching and decided on The Churchill Arms, a pub dating back to 1750 which the grandparents of Winston Churchill used to visit! When we arrived the entire pub was watching a rugby match. I don't really know the rules or anything, but it was exciting to be in the midst of the excitement!My husband ordered a pint of London Pride and I tried the Cornish Orchards cider - yum! I would definitely come back - very cozy!

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Everyone watching the rugby match
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Inside
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Exterior

09VLU5dN60YXEIyzGj-rbw.text: Everything here that we ordered was sooooo good. Fried rice full of flavor and not greasy. Pad Thai so tasty and not fake peanut buttery. And a perfect Guinness to boot. Five stars!

SFB-KgXXEDkyX_hafhjgBg.text: Place is beautiful on the outside and very cute on the inside. Reason for three stars is the Service wasn't great. They tell you "one hour then you go" when you're seated. They dropped off my food and never came back - not even to drop off the bill. Food was good but I've heard there's better Thai food nearby. I would definitely go back to have drinks at the bar

U1g0J0BK66ilZMntL7aMUw.text: Great atmosphere, nice food, fast service, interesting combo of British bar and Thai restaurant.

j6INT3fJOjdVQp2cSuP0YA.text: While the pub looks pretty well worth the visit I guess. The Thai restaurant at the back is pretty average. Also we didn't find it be a kid friendly place to dine in. Wouldn't recommend if you have kids. They refuse to serve simpleboiled noodles to kids. They said you can order any of the noodles dishes and pick out the meat/veggies yourself. We were quite surprised as to why wouldn't they just serve the plain noodles which they anyways have in the kitchen. Overall very bad experience. Our previous review citing the same experience was deleted by the owner. What a way to insult yourself even more!

6DbtKm2Hi44y0CS6Mczorg.text: It's a shame such a big restaurant refuses to serve simple boiled noodles (which am they have tons!) to kids. We didn't dine here as they are not at all kid friendly.

LBb3Eo5W58kv387gA9CnhA.text: Great Thai food, average beer selection and BRILLIANT atmosphere. It's a bit too busy for my liking, but oh well.

TnLS6sNk8oYnBi1831uoQw.text: Really more of a fan of the decor and atmosphere than the food. I ordered the Pad Siew, which was far more greasier than it needed to be... but would be the perfect hangover cure. The pub itself doesn't have the atmosphere the dining room does.. so if you do come, make sure to come for a meal.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom

9Kqs-Xw0LT3ES1HhruDz_w.text: Thai restaurant in the back of the pub is the highlight. Make a reservation or plan to have a couple pints while you wait for a table to open up. Well worth the wait. Only critic is the limited selection of beers on tap. Plenty of ales/lagers, but no pales.

5jXH9zPUjIle7KlVlqSuyw.text: Love the decorations, it makes me feel I walked into a castle of flowers. You cannot expect it to be too fancy, I mean, it's a bar, but the food are tasty and quite homey.

IaNfa0HrQ8s2DDI9Syc6mw.text: The beer was a little warm but the vibe was really cool. Definitely check it out if you're in the neighborhood, close to the underground.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Exterior
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. London Pride

X7bbDOufwLgB02TDwZRyKg.text: A beautiful, busy pub in a gorgeous area. The outer walls are bursting with flowers and it's so charming!The interior is kitschy and intimate, albeit quite loud with the evening crowds. During the after-work rush it took about 15 minutes to get a beer at the bar (we went for the Staropramen - a nice, middle of the road Czech beer). Without a reservation we only waited 30 minutes for a table in the attached Thai restaurant. The Thai food is awesome! The prawn crackers are a must, and it seems that you would enjoy any dish you order! Definitely check it out.

Mx7tBaOIfSgVGEb8ME3jWQ.text: Great atmosphere and quality Thai food makes for a happy me!  We dropped into this place for lunch and were told we could only sit for an hour, but it was definitely enough time to enjoy a delicious lunch.  We had the pad thai and the duck curry, both of which were very good.  I don't like bean sprouts in pad thai and theirs had very little of them.  The duck curry was not too hot and it was super tasty.  One of the best things about this place are the all the decorations!  The back has hanging plants covering the ceiling, making you feel like you're in a garden.  The pub section has pots and pans hanging from the ceiling all over.  There is so much to look at it's difficult to explain everything.  The outside is just as interesting as the inside!  Loved everything about our lunch!Warning: we came here a few nights before for food, but the kitchen closes at 10pm, which is when we arrived, so we left.  It seemed like a fun night spot while we were in there though!

d4nTAPPCioWqABC1Im4_gg.text: We ordered a chicken dish and a prawn dish at the Thai restaurant inside.  The meat was not fresh and the sauce was not authentic. Would not go again.

T-HQVbymQo812iMhX0fqIA.text: Food is amazing. Service was awful. Some of rudest staff I have ever met. We didn't get waters until the end of the meal. The waitress at the end threw our money across the table. It was crazy. I guess they assume they can serve good food and forget the good service? We ate Panang curry and pad Thai both were very good.

TQyHvmJ4Qc1ayj2sd94j3Q.text: Went here for dinner and drinks, defo recommend! Fab Thai food, great little old boozer seeped in history! They have heaps of chamber pots (and the odd bed pan) hanging from the ceiling! my type of place for sure!  The fire's are great but alas, they are fake and only look the part, still lovely!Yep, worth a visit, gets busy, food yummy, guinness not bad and yeah, if you are in the area, go there!

PhVO0Mrx_HgUlqMdufmScw.text: Who would expect Thai food in a pub!? It was fabulous! I love Thai and i like it very spicy...so be prepared if they say it's a spicy dish IT IS! I highly recommend coming here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. St Patrick's Day

7f40kL7OMVOVgTbg3UpJNw.text: Gerry, the manager has been here as long as I can remember. He is a perfectionist and a great lover of Winston Churchill, who the pub is named after. Many flowers, and photos of Churchill. Thai food, excellent, and the road was closed when they had a party last year. The Mayor of Kensington attended. Gerry has clout in this neighbourhood.

77TBGfNCxudXHggIRUkDxg.text: Stopped in here for pints and thai food a few weeks back after my cousin recommended Churchill Arms as 'the best pub on the planet'. Whilst I don't know that I would go that far I would say it is at least a good local,full of friendly people, nice dark ambience, lots of Churchill Memorabilia, good pints, and filling spicy thai food.

K_9RQsgqySSw_Odx-WOVxQ.text: This is my go to pub when in London. It's one of the few proper pubs independently owned. The outside facade is covered in flowers. On the inside antiques and relics hang and cover every inch of the walls. Beer deliciousThe best part is the food - some of the best Thai food I have ever had and every inexpensive.Get there early because it fills up quick!!!

Z6voBVdVC2LLW5mnwKINlg.text: After seeing The Churchill Arms in my local restaurant feed for months, finally tried it. We sampled three main courses: mixed pad thai, kaeng Penang, and pad ga prow. The pad thai was the winning dish but would have been nicer if served with some lime wedges for freshness. Lovely flavour otherwise. The bill with two pints only came to about £30, so was a tasty & good value.

egXT-kL6wNaqn3JNsMJ3DQ.text: Beautiful place, both inside and out. Just covered in green. The Thai restaurant is in the back, and it is full of real plants and flowers, which creates a damp, humid atmosphere. I was with a party of 8 on a Monday night, we had a reservation - and good thing too. This place was off the hook. Reservation essential. The restaurant team was very efficient. I had a vegan rice and rice dish (the server understood this meant no fish or oyster sauce), which I'd requested mildly spicy. Now, I enjoy spicy food but I couldn't even finish my dish. So be warned! Afterwards, we moved into the pub for drinks. Nice, relaxed ambiance. Definitely recommended.

fFs739BcaiRdgqsx4YUOxQ.text: Literally the best Thai food I have had in London. Perfectly balanced flavours. Taste of lemon grass, fish sauce and coconut. Very cheap considering the location. I come here very often especially that pub itself is really nice.  Remember to make a reservation because it's so good that it's almost always ver

t4EuHOkoB29rgBluoAFo4w.text: This has been one of my favorites and a must visit with each trip to London for years.  The bar is outstanding.  I love the quirky and rich décor and always enjoy the Fuller's cask offerings.  But the Thai restaurant in back is what sets it apart.  The food is authentic, tasty and a good value.  I always go spicier than I should but never regret it.  I love this place!

S1ULvMcH6Ogqguj8ijDSQw.text: Friggin thievery central! You know how you don't really pay too much attention to those 'pickpocketers operating' or 'keep your stuff with you at all times' signs? Well at The Churchill Arms, you really should!I got my bag lifted there last night and the bar staff were so unsurprised looking that I figured it must happen all the time. Other than that, it's a fairly decent bar. An odd mixture of Irish and English that seems really weird together. They also serve Thai food. I'm really not sure why, it's very shizophrenic.

SJjoj2P8iunH4F_nYdwEXg.text: During my business trip to London, I ended up at this restaurant as a recommendation from a colleague.  It's 10 minutes from High Kensington Street station and a very nice walk.  The service is fast/good and the food was really good.  The ambiance is very different/nice and first time I've been to a restaurant where you have to go through a pub to get to the restaurant.  Each time, I ordered Rad Na and loved it.  If you love flat noodles, gravy and veggies -- get this dish!  As for drinks, I ordered a lemon-aid during my second visit.  Heads up -  It's basically seltzer water and a lemon wedge.Next time I'm working in London, I'll be visiting this restaurant again.

_oX1FfKInqsZp-aCuao_HA.text: For a pub with food this place has it all:Thai food is very good (they also serve traditional British pub fare).Atmosphere is bright and airy in the butterfly covered and glassed in conservatory in the rear.Outside of the Pub is an amazing exterior covered with flowers.  It's one of the most beautiful pub's I've seen.

W0zOikD7Evg8hJq7OBcnUA.text: This is a fine old lady of a pub with a decent selection of (Fuller's) ales. It should be a 4* pub, and Beer in the Evening and whatnot suggest it once was, but the indifferent service & crowds make it less so.There's decent food, though it's Thai food. It's good for Thai, but I don't understand combining Thai food & pubs. Someone should explain it to me.Teetering on the cusp of going to 4* for me, but it's going to stick at 3. Grand. Nothing wrong, but it doesn't feel special. Crowds? Staff who look like Saturday AM came about 12 hours too soon and hit a bit too hard? Overheated (we don't need heating and fire on when it's 11 degrees outside)... Not sure, but leaving I felt less good than walking in.

PvUB9ORrh1qgpbXrihlKzw.text: Sorry to say, asking me and my girlfriend to leave our table before finishing our last drink that we paid for deserves a one star rating. We paid good money for our experience and travelled far for it and this just left a bad taste in our mouths.

r8icMUUNz2z2zJyNfvuAVQ.text: Tasty food, quick service, very lovely ambiance with fresh pots of flowers. FYI, there is no prawn in the prawn cracker! Vegetable spring rolls are good!

WbAlGYU3cZsU1qTYJZ8dkw.text: This place is fantastic. It is busy and hard to find a table. But we snagged a table by the bar (these are first come and first serve) and ordered drinks. When you sit in the bar area you can still order food - just walk back to the restaurant to order and pay and they will bring your food to your table when it's ready.  You can stay at the bar tables as long as you want.  The restaurant tables require a wait.  Thai food was fantastic, the drinks are great and the vibe is awesome. If you want to go to a place that's lively and enjoyed by locals - this is the place to be!

_zNOEJKzrzlGAf-iSYQIeg.text: I would come here for the decor alone! Historic posts and seasons extras made this a cheerful place to visit. The mid day mid week clientele were older and adorable as well as welcoming to us inquisitive Americans.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom

54qBFDSugIo6HWxYklAgnA.text: No visit to London town would be complete without a stroll through the beautifully quaint neighborhood of Notting Hill. It's here that you'll find one of the most wonderful surprises, a Thai restaurant hidden inside a dimly-lit oasis of flowers and memorabilia housed within a traditional British pub. It is one of the most delightfully odd combinations you'll encounter in the English capital. Delightful surprise aside, the Thai food was amazing! Authentic, delicious, and at a good price!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Inside the restaurant area
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Inside the pub area
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Outside

NK_E4K59WWdyjFdwNu3N0g.text: It's a nicely decorated pub that serves Thai food, what's not to love?  Throughout the years it seems that Churchill Arms has become a hotspot for tourists attracted to its lovely exterior but it's definitely still a worthwhile place to visit in my books!Come for a cheeky pint but stay for the spicy dishes.  While it's not the most amazing or authentic Thai I've had, it sure hits the spot when you have a hankering for some noodles or curry.  During Christmas, they take the decorations a step further and the entire outside of the pub is beautifully lit up with lights and it's not to be missed!

lse-fH70z2SVBeOot131ew.text: Yum some great Thai food ! The front serves as a bar with a great atmosphere . The ales and lager options were awesome. The back is a Thai restaurant with some great food. There's a bit of a crowd but worth the wait . Plus you can always have a beer while waiting =)Ordered a spicy prawn dish (#16) ... if you can handle the heat ... well worth it .Oh and great prices !

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. #16 under noodles ( prawn )

r5DFabIjpSPqkU4D3mqW-Q.text: The food here was really good. The one caveat to mention is the set up is confusing. For example, there are two parts of the restaurant -a pub that is loud and smells strongly of beer and a thai restsurant that is much more quiet and refined. Be sure you go to the section that you prefer based on your scene for the night.

Xr2v7RJUxCYX4dwil1Swiw.text: Beautiful and unique bar and Thai restaurant with amazing hanging plants and decor, a must go!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. The charming ambiance and plants.
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Jungle curry and pad Thai, delicious!

b4S-e0Lqb_L3BBiQJ7JRyQ.text: Nice place. It's a bar in the front and in the back there is a Thai restaurant. You could sit "outside" and enjoy your meal, but you have a 1 hour time limit to eat so be aware. Food is ok compared to all the Thai food I've ever had, but it's a nice spot for a meal. Staff were very friendly and courteous. You could get some nice pictures here as well. Just don't stand in the middle of the street like some one did. Go across the street.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom

UNSq8Eebmiu5U-AeUE5I6Q.text: This is a must stop!  We had the best time meeting some Brits!This is the second most popular pub in London.  The food is outstanding too.  Try all of the ales and lagers!

xKFeIkXIJvDF_e_rISqY0w.text: We discovered this place to go for drinks. It's a classic English pub. What we didn't realize was the food here is AMAZING!!  They serve Thai food and it is so flavorful. I'm from Los Angeles and often I find it hard to find a wide range of Asian food in Europe that's full of flavor and compares with food in LA. This place does. They even had great vegan options for our friends that ate with us.

CZi1HmUJ8kuhDfa52snkvg.text: I've admired the Churchill Arms from across the Atlantic for years. You could say this place is "Instagram famous." I've seen countless of Instagram pics of this beautiful pub in London that is covered in flowers. The Churchill Arms didn't even seem real to me. How can a place so beautiful actually exist? Knowing that I was finally going to visit London, the Churchill Arms was on the top of my list of places to visit. When I actually arrived, luckily, it did not disappoint.This place is just as  beautiful as in the pictures. When I saw it for the first time, I thought maybe I had stepped into a Jane Austen novel. Flowers covered the entire building and it was like looking at a dream. Inside, the walls and ceiling at covered with knick knacks and artifacts. Most would think this clutters the pub, but I think it gives it certain character and adds to the whimsical setting. While at the pub my sister and I decided to have lunch. In the back of this out of world pub, is a Thai restaurant. I got my usual Pad Thai, and I can't remember what my sister got, but there were no complaints, so I think she liked it. The food was nothing special, but it was still tasty. I think the ambiance is what really makes this place memorable.I'm not sure I would recommend anyone to visit the Churchill Arms just for Thai food, but I would  say if you want to drink in a beautiful bar, this is the place to go.

Z4wTwFZovf_7BRYzAJpJuw.text: For starters this place is not a steak house. So if you're in the mood for steak hint they serve Chinese food!!!  not steak, Chinese food!!!  The place was packed but their service sucked.  I don't know how it got such rave reviews and why this place is promoted as a steak house.  Walked about a mile and a half in anticipation of a great steak and ended up having to eat pad thai. Not only that but the staff pressed me to pay my check the moment I ordered.  No Thank you. Giving them 2 stars I think is generous

Ccykh-fXB_FJRvn8Cdb3MQ.text: Great, unexpected Thai food! Very courteous to Americans. Portions are well sized and flavors are phenomenal. A nice change from the typical pub food. Plus, the inside of this place is so cute and quaint with a lot of greenery. A must-go in London!

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Cute exterior

lRK-YuRwyTu_Y8G0-LccAw.text: This was a great gem recommended to me by some American expats in London. The bar has a unique decor and a cool ambiance - part pub and part Thai restaurant. The food was amazing and the place looked to be popular with locals and tourists alike. I had the jungle curry, which was spicy but not too spicy so long as you like spicy food. It did seem like there was a long wait, but you can just grab a punt and watch some football while you wait.

OVUsvtaf4MYq_Q6d9lE-Gg.text: Beautiful old English pub with flowers galore.If your looking for traditional English pub food this isn't the place. All Thai food, the only thing English here in the beer. Waitress told use we had to finish in one hour and told use we had to order whole meals. Never again

ZtpHT3BR022tVRiPN_E8aA.text: When planning our trip to London, this was a must do for my husband. Obviously the facade of the building is photo worthy and beautiful but even more so he was excited to try the Thai food! We made a reservation (had to do it via phone) and I am glad we did. It was very busy, which I assume is how it normally would be. We printed the coupon for a free drink off of their website, that was a definite plus! I ordered the shrimp pad Thai and my husband ordered the chicken pad see ew. Both dishes was delicious. We had another couple with us that really enjoyed their dishes as well. The best surprise was the spring rolls. They was amazing! We ordered two plates of them!

F82NVJbQs44VZA9bhDf9JA.text: I loved the flowers. The decor is really nice and impressive. But unfortunately it cannot cover up a nasty smell inside. Thai food (completed with a rude service) is average at most.

4tExGusT52DmVy2RHdIxyQ.text: This was such a neat pub! Loved all the fresh flowers inside. Very unique. I had pad Thai and it was excellent. Very reasonably priced. Definitely a good one to check out especially if you like Thai food.

Aw5Uy-5YBqYrwfy3BdCt3Q.text: The pub part of the place was bumping and full of excitement. The restaurant side had the same lovely decor much much less of a crowd. The Thai food was good but not incredible or unique. This is more of a place to visit to take pictures or have a pint.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom

oIf5LBoWfVqOB84YL6lS_Q.text: Excellent Thai food. Priced right, great selection of Pub drinks etc. nice people, always crowded, but a lot of seating so not too much problem of waiting. I like all the selections and you just can't go wrong here.

PQTqqoyBGZJsFrAZ8Z16Mg.text: The BEST pies ever!! Loved going here and hanging out with my work colleagues!! Great times!

wQSGY6BuOb5a1NmEwX1UFg.text: Awesome vibe at this Winston Churchill relic pub and thai restaurant on the back.  Love the green curry!

xai3om2-uInFy4h6Xn8wgQ.text: The Churchill Arms is one of the local pubs in my area. It's located on Kensington Church St, not far from Notting Hill Gate Underground Station. I like it because it's sort of quirky looking with lots of hanging baskets on the oustide of the pub (as you can see from the picture). The bar area is pretty small, but in the summertime it's actually quite nice just to stand outside. There is also a restaurant area that has been recognised for it's great Thai food, which is delicious and pretty inexpensive. They also do three types of roast dinner on a Sunday. A really lovely pub in a nice area with friendly staff. Definitely recommend going there.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Churchill Arms, Kensington Church St, W8

QL2nkCSe74LFXZS44pBc3w.text: I exaggerate alot, but I think this has to be best value meal in London. Great food for an amazing price. Couple that with a picturesque pub and the Churchill Arms is always a great experience.

WZCu5goh8zTY3egfaxnj4A.text: Churchill Arms may be the most charming pub in London. From the hanging baskets both inside and outside to the funky decor, it certainly packs a big punch with ambience. The thai food was very good for pub grub, and an absolute steal for this neighbourhood. However, it left my tummy feeling a bit "uneasy." Don't want to necessarily blame the pub on that, but it did leave me with an imperfect impression of the place. That said, I'll definitely go back and give it another go!

R5QFvyIwFGrtjT5NYa8wLw.text: Every Year when I am at an Exhibition in the Olympia Hall it is a definite MUST to meet a friend at this bar. It is a very very very inspiring place with good fresh beer and at least when I was there very atentive and attractive staff. See you in December!

s47jiaZfjkpotJoRbOuTjg.text: Stonking place. Packed even on a Monday night, which tells you a lot. We eventually came in here for a nightcap, as it was totally rammed at first attempt, which is a shame as we had been lured in by the delicate waft of Thai spices and the promise of a great atmosphere. Ok, so drinking options are about as standard as you are going to find, but the interior entirely mitigates this. It's like wandering into a witchdoctor's bar with low end of the spectrum lighting and strange voodoo like watering cans and rugby balls hanging off the ceiling, even a (quite useful) signpost. As mentioned by other qypers, the Thai section is a brighter palm leafed little oasis to the side of the bar. It's a wonderful symbiosis which results in an inviting and charactered spot to socialise in, ably assisted by lovely staff.

s9uc2QrmaaEIR8q2WgmYAA.text: Tasty Pad Thai, well-kept Chiswick, courteous staff and very cool decor inside and out. What more could you want? Oh, you want your meal for under a tenner as well? Done. Get there really early or really late, 'cause the place is rammed around mealtimes.

jxdi-CvO-70oYIyeBOZZ7A.text: Another cursed-name venue, but hey it seems that it's blessing in disguise!Churchill's IS the epitome of good pub foodForget sausage & mash or fish and chips though: we're talking Thai pub food. Go and see it for yourself, it's only 5 minutes from Notting Hill Gate station. You'll get your money worth: £ 6 for a big phat noodle or rice meal! Don't get put off by the pub side of the pub where Churchill governs on wallpaper, but head straight to the green back garden, which is actually where the action is. This may sound very adventurous, but I just make-believe: I usually only stick with Pad Thai (number 5 or 6 on the menu).

w7nr2ffRHWfpuUBJnEz-yQ.text: The gem of Kensington, in my opinion, the Churchill Arms is both an excellent British pub, and exceptional Thai restaurant. It is as if someone decided to put two of my favourite things together in one building! The pub interior, decorated with a bizarre arrangement of random memorabilia, is intriguingly fascinating. It is often busy, but always relaxed, and once can usually find some standing space to enjoy a traditional pint. (Standing outside is often the preferred practice in warmer months).The Thai restaurant round back is like another world  a leafy oasis, with tables to fit any group. The food is fantastic  the pad thai being a consistant favourite  and meals are extremely good value, with generous mains under £10. The only problem I have with Churchill Arms is that it is not closer to my house.Like, next door.

huTVwh5429i6CcFZHaYsbg.text: This place is actually called The Churchill Arms, but it's certainly true that it serves up incredibly tasty and massively popular Thai food from its busy kitchen. It's located halfway between Notting Hill Gate and High Street Kensington. The exterior of the pub is an explosion of mutli-coloured floral baskets. Inside is an even more intense explosion ofwell, everything. Books and weapons and instrument cases and bicycles and everything under the sun lines every square inch of wall and ceiling in here. The place is crammed full of bits of history. The drinks are what you'd expect: Fuller ales, lagers, spirits, and wine. It's for the Thai food that people pack the place out. You get a lot for the money, and they don't scrimp on the spices. Get in early, order, and enjoy the great pub character while you wait.

2s2k78xLOBrv5P6fT7pY9Q.text: You can't miss this place in summer due to the amount of hanging baskets this pub has. Never before have I seen a building so devoted to floral attire! Inside it is eccentric in the old english pub way, pots and pans hanging from the ceilings, old photographs etc etc. The pub leads through to the restaurant which continues the over abundance in plant theme. You can get Thai food here if you manage to get a table - this place get rammed, in fact I have never actually been able to sit down in this pub.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom

wf5WQ02wrCbAHU6FBoQd7w.text: This pub is very close to my office so I have been there many times. What I love about this pub is that it's just full of character which is rare these days with the pub chain filled high streets around London. As well as being a great pub to go for a drink, I think it serves great Thai food which is not only tasty but also great value for money. The only downside of going to eat here is that if you enter the 'restaurant section' of the pub at the back then the table is normally turned around in about an hour. So if you fancy going there one evening and are planning to stay a while, I would suggest securing a table in the bar area first so that you can eat and then sit and chat over a beer or three. Would highly recommend giving Churchill's a try when you are next in the area!!

eqZuJSl9Htg454o2xbE0YA.text: The first thing you'll notice about the Churchill Arms is the huge flower display outside. The name of the pub is barely readable amongst it all. If there is a sports tournament/war memorial etc. going on somewhere in the world, there's a good chance landlord Gerry's barstaff will have gone all out to represent it with inflatables and memorabilia. There's loads of other interesting collections on the walls an, of course, tons of Churchill stuff. After you're good and drunk, had the spilt drink trick played on you by Gerry and watched the sport, you should move to the courtyard at the back and have one of the best Thai meals in London. Winner of the 1999 Evening Standard Pub of the Year, it hasn't dropped an ounce of quality since. Great for families, dates, meeting mates or a quiet one after work, The Churchill Arms is the ultimate Central-West London public house.

zcetb-kZa7qq82dNqzwkAw.text: One of my favourite pubs. The real ales are varied and excellent. The room is publy attractive. The staff are competent and quick. The patrons are diverse and uniformly friendly. The Thai food is filling, flavorful and inexpensive (very inexpensive).This is a great place to watch Formula 1 or football. I last watched England draw with the USA in World Cup group play and the crowd was polite to both sides.This is one to try.

Amn_mWN3C3ufKNcX2zprOw.text: I've never really understood the fuss about this place, though being Australian perhaps I am not as enamoured with the idea of putting Thai food in a pub which is quite common in Sydney. The food is good not great, but it gets packed and it's always really uncomfortable. For my money I would go to a Thai Restuarant and eat in less cramped conditions and then go to a pub after.

j-gMenpX_NDzbe9pb5TiFQ.text: Good food and massive portions but it is hot hot hot!! I'm not usually a wimp when it comes to heat but my duck curry nearly blew my head off! Ask for mild and see how you go. Lovely little conservatory area out in the back and eveything tastes authentic and fresh.

BbTC3MwM5HF2XtLliVPSyw.text: One of my favourite pubs in London. Only real downside is the popularity, which makes it a complete pain in the ass to find a table, or a spot at the bar. The interior is completely mad; all kinds of junk hanging from the ceilings and walls, WW2 propoganda posters everywhere, and a restaurant cum greenhouse selling Thai food out the back. If you can get here early, and grab a table, then I can highly recommend it, otherwise I'd give it a miss for somewhere less crowded.

JaEysnNbJFTMPirLjlbbxw.text: One of the loveliest pubs I have been to. It is very pretty and you can enjoy different types of food firstly, my friends and I stayed in the pub area and had some lovely beers (they have got a great selection there in the pub) and then secondly, we moved on to a Thai restaurant in the same pub which was fantastic, food was lovely spiced up. I can definitely recommend it. Would go there again and again.

Hz3ks-z6_V9095J_ml7c3A.text: London is expensive.Churchill arms is the best of both worlds.  A traditional english pub + a thai restaurant hidden in the back.The prices were extremely reasonable and the portions were huge.  The wait can be a bit long during peak hours, but that is just because it is so popular and the seating is limited.Spiciness for each dish is measured using a 1-3 butterfly system.  I have tried the 3 butterfly and it makes you sweat.  The type of sweat that you appreciate, if you are a spicy food lover.  A must visit, if you are in London and are having trouble adapting to the english pub food.

8yEkaYtBNFS_w-OxbrbEfw.text: The Churchill Arms is certainly atmospheric.  Its theme is pots, pans, plants (and Winston Churchill), and I suppose this is charming, but on most nights I have found it chaotic and a bit claustrophobic.  Like the exterior (which is drowning beautifully in hanging and potted plants), the Thai restaurant in the back in also drowning in plants, so much so that a tall person will easily find their head caught up amongst the greenery falling from the ceiling.  I finally had a chance to eat here - after hearing about its famous cheap Thai - and yes, it was pretty cheap.  But the food was as good as any cheap Thai food.  And instead of being intrigued by the little room and its dichotomy to the old English boozer I entered, I found it oddly unpleasant.  It feels like a fast food joint (but cleaner and with live plants), complete with harsh lighting, flimsy tables and laminated menus, was picked off a street corner and attached to the pub.  And the service!  I know they really try to turn tables here, but I swear to you that we were asked - by sweet-faced waitresses that quickly turned surly - if we were ready to order TEN times within 20 minutes of sitting.  And 9 of these times came after we had ordered wine and appetizers.  And did I mention there were at least 5 empty tables in the room?

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom

WRkSz8XXsttcPgAY55Nggg.text: Best Thai food I've had in London... and it's AT A PUB!!!  Get a beer in the front while you wait for a table, and then head to the back and eat some excellent Thai food - it actually tastes authentic.  Everything we ordered was top notch, so go family style if you want and share a few different things.  Very reasonably priced as well!

8as9VX7rhsntRSNxP9tofA.text: How can you go wrong with a traditional English pub that also serves Thai food? Answer is you can't, but that's not to say there isn't room for improvement. Dining without a reservation, we had about a 40 minute wait--not bad and the Notting Hill neighborhood is one to walk around in the meantime. Once seated, the food was solid, but the atmosphere itself was awesome. The pub is decked out with plants and flowers and while a bit claustrophobic at times, was beautiful. The Thai menu is not very expansive, but that's ok given the entire experience. The Thai egg rolls were a winner, fresh and crisp, and the cashew chicken had the spice done right--not overwhelming, but a lingering kick. The lack of Thai iced coffee or tea was a bit of a disappointment, but the pints more than made up for it. The restaurant and bar seemed to be independent operations, but that didn't distract. As an annoying American, I could do without dogs in bars (there were at least 2), but overall, the experience was pretty solid and worth a try.

Y2FywJ3m4bGmwCU69yjglg.text: Never been to the Churchill Arms as a pub, only for the Thai food in the back!  Was recommended to me by a colleague.  Amazing Pad Thai and Green curry, large portions, mostly everything on the menu is only £6!! They don't take reservations for lunch, but in the evenings it's a MUST as it get's super busy. The staff are all very friendly and accomodating. Mostly go only with a friend or two, but one time they made room for a whole gaggle of girls (at least 10).

rcXpwGit-CQopPFj9Du0dA.text: The flowers outside this pub are so impressive and enjoyable to see. The inside of the pub is very "old school". We enjoyed grabbing a pint or two here, yet mostly enjoyed the outside of the pub with the beautiful flowers on the street. Notting Hill is charming, this pub adds to the charm.

204ZphYQTtezo-gHfZlX8Q.text: Great pub, and delicious (and CHEAP!) thai restaurant in the back.This is a charming, local haunt that I frequent often.  Very typical neighborhood English pub up front, and charming little butterfly/conservatory themed Thai restaurant out back.  The thai food is surprisingly good, given the price point.Beware, though, 3-stars spicy, while good, is REALLY SPICY (I eat loads of spicy food regularly).  Also, the wait staff always give the standard "only 1 hour" per seating thing at the beginning, but if it's not crowded, they don't hold you to it.  If you visit the pub during dinner time and think you might want to eat, be sure to go and put your name on the list for a table in advance if it's crowded, as it can get VERY crowded.

vijWbA2WqlEG92sWHFKjpg.text: The quintessential London pub - tons of character, fun crowd. We came one evening for drinks and came back a few nights later for Thai food. The dish I ordered (Panang Beef) was not what I expected and was a bit disappointing but my BF's chicken with basil was really tasty. If you are getting food I recommend a reservation because it does get crowded. The "garden room" in the back is unique, but a little questionable in terms of cleanliness- it's very cluttered. Anyway still a fun place with decent prices and food.

ozGKwW6juiBCvjA4VS-DCg.text: London, much more than new york, seems to be big on chain restaurants, its difficult to make it 60 feet without seeing another pret, 100 feet without an "eat", 120 feet without a costa, 150 feet without a starbucks, 200 feet without a major american chain (mcdonals, pizza hut, bk, subway, kfc), and 500 feet without a number of smaller other chains (pauls, thai square,  etc.). Omnipresent in this is the endless queue of pubs, most helping to further prove my favorite quote about london "You know- fish, chips, cup o' tea, bad food, worse weather, Mary f*cking Poppins...London"Here's the most normal looking pub you could find, then add a thai place around the corner of the bar. You know, the random bits and bobs, dark wood, 8 taps of fullers on cask, small woden tables, couples and their kids and dogs sitting around reading the paper, but then getting some pad thai and a curry.
