Its a concept i quite likeThe invisible que for tables in the pub part can be long and in the restaurnt peice it can be even harder at times but the food's quite solidIt may not be the best thai i've had, even in london, but the plates are generous and reasonably priced, spiced a little more to my mates tastes than mine (read: milder than you'd get in ny), the appetizers are quite small in comparison to the mains, but nice enough for them the main dishes come with rice without needed to order on the side (which seems to get more and more common each year)For a pint or three its nice to be able to get some craveworthy food right at the bar, likely worth 3.5 stars

tAWk5nhNHZsZz1CKU_NoEA.text: I really do enjoy this pub, it is one of my dad's favourites as well as I mine, which I think says a lot. You will find all sorts of ages in this pub but thankfully without any noisy big parties or teenagers. The look of the place is incredible. The outside is beautiful with all the flowers all over the building. The inside is like gymnastics for the eyes - there are so many things to see and you bounce from one artifact to the other. There are pots and pans hanging from the low ceiling as well as rugby balls now because it is the season. The owner of the pub is always around and he is such a laugh. He clears the glasses of the table with his hooked cane so beware if it comes swooshing close to you! The back of the pub has a conservatory/ butterfly exhibition room which serves thai food. The thai food is very yummy and a good price. Unfortunately to eat in the actual restaurant you almos always need a reservation but the good news is that you can actually eat the thai food anywhere in the pub! So no need to reserve! I would definitely say this pub is worth a visit if you are in the area, beware though on Sundays it gets very busy.

zHWeXaKNqMpqzftqJ4evUQ.text: Fantastic pub and Gerry behind the bar is a legend of a landlord.The Thai food's great, last time I was home it was GBP5.50 which is a steal for Kensington!  Not sure how much it is now!!The only gripe I have about the pub it that it's too small, there's not much they can do about that though!!  Any chance of opening a branch up in L.A.?!Keep up the good work Gerry and Up The Banner!!!

AIQS2O62-QMofFbjpOt6hg.text: My friend and I ordered the pad see eww and the duck curry.  Both were delicious and the portions were great. The prices for all the dishes were pretty reasonable.  We ordered the two mains and a bottle of wine and the total was about £29.  My only gripe was the one hour time limit per table bit - but I guess thats why the wait for a table isn't too terrible.  We basically attempted to down our wine in the remaining time period before we had to leave the table (2 minutes). Class!!

0TLeRsUHdGP6oh1UyI_ZmA.text: Had this place on my print out of BeerAdvocate places to visit, but only noticed it as we passed by it on a bus tour, so we had to memorize the way, as we waited for the next stop. Inside the place was really unique, with a butterfly garden in the back. People watching aspect of this place is extraordinary, and the beer selection is above average even for a place such as London. I would also imagine that this would be an easy sell for those BAs that have significant others that are not as keen on visit beer places, as this has a good amount of history and uniqueness for everyone who is visiting.

pppqQo5-uO3RIlsX_SPCIg.text: Churchills is my favourite pub in the area. They have a great selection of draught beer and lager and the pints are not to pricey. The décor is dark wood and very cosy. The sense of the place is old country and welcoming.What makes this pub so special is the Thai food. For £6 you can get a huge plate of Thai goodness. The Pad Thai is sensational. The service is quick and even when busy you get you food quickly. The eating area is split. There is a restaurant at the back where you get full table service, or you can sit in the pub and you grab your own drinks from the bar. (No service charge for the latter.)Be warned the menu dishes have chillies next to them to indicate spice level. I love hot food and went for a level three. The food was so hot I though my brain would incinerate. Play it safe and go for a one or two if unsure.

L7ln7GPekZW6tK0dU4btoQ.text: Not recommended for tall people, unless you enjoy having your head amongst a diverse mix of low-flying plant life, butterflies and general knick-knackery! But, all that stuff does make this an interesting and unique pub. What's more - they've somehow sneaked in a small Thai restaurant in the back. I love this concept, but in reality it serves a very limited selection of quite basic and unspectacular Thai dishes. The prices are what you'd reasonably expect for food that isn't going to blow you away. Very busy on the Friday night I went, with a one hour wait for dinner at 8.30pm.

mRRSpgiWcsM0Dc5fSre5gw.text: this is a random place, but in a good way.  i was looking on yelp to see where i could meet my friend in the area and thought churchill arms was perfect...thai food and beer.  what could be that?we shared the prawn pad thai and some other prawn stir fried dish w/ peppers.  it had a level 3 spice, which is the spiciest they have, and there actually was spice (even by my chinese and my korean friend's standards).  portions were pretty good, and the food was tasty, so i will be back.

Sj9UwURlvqpY2k0RchAovA.text: Must be memorable or my South African friend would not have remembered it so fondly from his months living and working in the big smoke? This character filled pub gets so busy that they've started hanging their memorabilia from the ceilings. It houses more than just a pub, however. There is an equally busy and popular restaurant serving Thai food in the back. Food was tasty and service acceptable, if a little rushed.

jNuuCGEiWnn_WU1dyWhoRQ.text: Fantastic Pub. I've only been there once but I am dying to go back and can't recommend it highly enough! It's a great place to take people that are over as tourists. Full of character and full to the brim inside with interesting things to look at. Lovely friendly barstaff, good range of drinks on offer. The icing on the cake is the lovely Thai restaurant out the back (or you can eat in the bar/pub area), fantastic food at a really good price and again really lovely surroundings. In the Summer there is an amazing display of flowers outside.

FMPMlJ6Ufy_L-T3x9YUcWQ.text: This pub looks great not just from the outside, but check out the Thai dining room! Plants galore :) Really good (and cheap!) Thai food in the back of the pub. It gets very busy though, so without a reservation, you'll most likely have a wait and not get into the main dining room (still, even then it's worth it). You can order your drinks from the main pub bar bit to enjoy with your delicious London Thai cuisine :) Watch out for the particularly spicy dishes!

ikZq-A05STyU7WAqVp7iHw.text: Must be about the only pub in the world that has a picture of Churchill above a Céad Míle Fáilte sign (its owned by a Irish fella so there's a strange mix of decoration) Great wee pub,good for conversation and the kinda place where you can chat about somethin random with the people sitting beside you; not easy to find in this town I tell ya!

896iELqyTrg1V8LubWV-tg.text: Pub is nice but the Thai restaurant in the back which use to be good has gone right down hill, surly service and small portions, takeaway is even worse, £7.50 for half a portion of pad Thai with 3 bits of chicken, poor value. This place use to be very good will not go again am now a fan of the Thai at the latimer pub hammersmith road.

vXgJdUvleI1UW7rOvq7oPQ.text: Pretty much an awesome pub, though it's more of a novelty pub than a real pub you'd go to regularly. Full of tourists but the potties, knick knacks and thai food make up for it. In summer you won't see it for hanging baskets, so keep your eyes peeled.

wtkbLvkQnCkNyGf3jEL5fg.text: The Churchill arms is absolutely beautiful, dressed in flowers on the outside with the feel of a garden on the inside. We came for dinner, because I read that Thai in the UK is a must just as Indian food is. The Churchill did not disappoint, I had the pad see ew and it was better than my go to Thai place back at home in the NYC, as reluctant as I am to say so. The Thai tea is delicious and refreshing. The service however was not the best, they rush you and border in rude when you ask for anything.

6xTjwjpFP6V7iEVpFO8bbw.text: Amazing Thai food and wonderful pub atmosphere!  A must see every time you're in London.

BQWfjryFii1tOwNyovqHYg.text: Cutest pub in London and for sure a photo opportunity not to be missed! And if it's Christmas-wait till you see it!Just down the street from Portobello Market and a great stop after.Oddly, there is a Thai restaurant in the back which was pretty good!Of note-across the street is a great bakery to grab that much needed sweet to complement the Thai spicy!

QGZ7gJOVhfR_a_VOzncPyQ.text: Great service. Bar staff is amazing and was incredibly helpful while we we were lost. Great Thai food!

h3--oZzQFu3lj-xhA2KIIw.text: We went for dinner at the restaurant, and it was really mediocre at best. Our pad thai was average, though the portions were good for sure. Service was what annoyed me the most. First, the staff member that accepted my reservation took down my name wrong. Second, when we asked why our food was delayed behind those that ordered after us, we got very uninterested and curt response. Overall, a lot of room for improvement in terms of service. Ambience was unique and interesting for sure. Both the exterior and the interior were a sight to behold.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom

55ogquaP7j9U37OwIsG6mg.text: What a fabulous restaurant! So much fun to be in the garden of flowers. The food was great and quick to the table. Loved the ambience! Can't wait to return.

nx9rMui9G0xrVn0TDfd7ew.text: Granted, London is know for its rude people, but there's no one ruder than that old battle axe who runs the Thai restaurant in the back. "You have one hour. One hour to eat and then you go," is her standard greeting I heard repeated several times while others we being seated. Service was reasonably quick and efficient - the old lady probably starts cutting off digits if they dally too long at a table.The food itself is average Thai food, it will probably fit the bill if you're out getting hammered but this place has all the charm of a Waffle House. Do yourself a favor, book a table at Siam Secret - the best Thai food I've ever had outside of Thailand.

3hsxEttNGWzpuAU2TAT19g.text: Beautiful pub near Chelsea in London. Went on one of my many exploration treks when I was visiting the city for my birthday this past August. There is a lot of Churchill memorabilia there. Apparently he spent a lot of time at this pub, writing and sometimes delivering speeches during his time in Parliament as Prime Minister. I loved the atmosphere! The pub seems to serve mostly Fuller's brand, which was great (my favorite beer is the Fullers ESB :D). I had lunch at the restaurant (which is just behind the pub). They server Thai food, which was delicious. I am not a fan of Asian food, but I made an exception here. The food had the right amount of spice and paired great with the beer I was having. One complaint! The person who seated me told me that 'we need the table in one hour.' I was a bit upset because I was willing to spend more money, but I didn't let it tarnish the whole experience. Will come back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Some of the great wall decor @ The Churchil Arms

0ydAO602eAGz3fb6aNhNGw.text: An eccentric little place where Winston Churchill's grandparents used to frequent is one of the most famous pubs in London. Its overgrown plant collection, large ale collection, and Churchill memorabilia make this small watering hole a must-stop destination for locals and tourists alike.Being the first pub to offer Thai food in London, Churchill Arms serves no-doubt authentic dishes, getting their spices just right. If it were not for the elbow-to-elbow atmosphere, this place would have gotten a 5-star from me. But I guess it's just all part of the Churchill Arms experience.Oh and if you sign up on their emailing list on the website, you get a free pint when you visit!

C2ApZITyJI68M--Dz3WQzQ.text: One of my favorite pubs to visit. I always enjoy going back. It's even cooler around Christmas when they go a bit overboard with the decorations. The Thai food is excellent and authentic. I would recommend having some along with some Fullers pints :)

Y580SbaDmSFoUZcU-N1l9g.text: First timer having pad Thai & I have to say I'm very impressed. This place was amazing. I will note that you have to make a reservation in order to get it for they are very busy. You are only allowed to really have a table for an hour, we stayed for around an hour & 30 mins but it was a week day so maybe they only mind on weekends. They also have great rice. Yummy !!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Pad Thai, shrimp rice, curry

1l5vU46y-cbxz9eddxGVUQ.text: Beautiful pub, great beer selection, friendly service. Incredible character. If you are visiting as a tourist, it is a must visit.

U2QZz-yNpuYgumwLiRRm4w.text: My home away from home. The perfect modern but traditional British pub. An amazing place to meet new friends with a great staff

hGdKE9rR6h_LEaHdyQXErg.text: The Thai restaurant here is a hidden gem tucked in the very back of a traditional English pub.  A tropical, green filled nook, the food was delicious (when they say spicy they mean it!), and plenty of it.  Easy on the wallet.

oF8d03XM8yo9Jh9LyOmvwQ.text: Always crowded but they will get you in because they kick everyone out after an hour LOL! Personally love the Thai green curry and my husband loves the Pad Thai. Everything delicious and the atmosphere is a festival for the eyes.

bZ-LogFtuLvCdojfQ7WDCw.text: Drinks only review.  This is a must do if you are near it.  It has quite a bit of character, and it was elbow to elbow the time i went (friday night).  Had several pints with a friend and it was an enjoyable time.  I love the fact that you can drink outside on the sidewalk.  I was a nice cool night and everyone was friendly and a few chatted me up while I waited for my friend.Not sure that I would want to spend much time inside, as it was pretty packed, but people were having a good time.

N6Gg8d0kwFNDvtGfYFy4FA.text: review only for the pub and atmosphere, not the foodit's so picturesque inside. like stepping back in time. decorated with all sorts of eclectic mementos hanging from the ceiling and tacked to the walls. beautifully lit inside. I was there on a Friday after work, so it was crowded, but I managed to find a seat at the bar and enjoy a few beers before dinner. the bartenders are very friendly and do a great job managing the chaoswill make it a regular stop when I'm in Kensington!

owMW2GnEPMG_vk87l0wXYw.text: The venue is too cool! On the outside the pub is covered in flowers. On the inside is British memorabilia from Churchill to Prince William and Kate, tacky in a fun way.  The funny thing is the bar is very British, but in the back room it is a Thai restaurant.  The host was extremely rude and rushed us.  The food was mediocre, but it was the first Asian food I've eaten in a week so I was happy. I may be spoiled, I lived in Thai Town in LA for a few years. I was just surprised that the food wasn't better because of the many positive reviews on Yelp. We got the pad Thai, fried rice and duck curry. Everything was good, but I've had  better. Fun venue to try! I'd recommend it because it's quirky :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Food was OK.
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Very pretty, covered in flowers.

Xa-DVOftYU6797AanBFXvA.text: The 2 stars are for the exterior of the building. We decided to visit, expecting a really quaint traditional English pub and I'm presuming that's exactly what you would get unless of course you want food. In which case you are told they are serving food 'out the back'. It's only when you get out the back you realise - hang on, this is a Thai restaurant. My wife loves Thai food so even though this was not what we were expecting (who expects a Thai restaurant out the back of a British pub?) we decided to try it.The experience was horrible. Before we even sat down we were told we had 1 hour to vacate the table. The tables are heaped on top of each other, clearly trying to cram as many customers as they can into a very limited space. We could hear every word of the couple's conversation next to us (they were on date #3 and she really wants to try snowboarding in case you're interested). The servers just dumped the food in front of us, adding to the feel of being on the clock - no time to chew, the food will digest in your stomach. The food itself - not being an expert in Thai food, I defer to my wife who said it was just ok. It was not exactly cheap for pretty average fare.Now, the piece de resistance, my wife's digestive system has been suffering considerably since we've eaten there. In this day and age, it really is unacceptable to suffer stomach and digestive complaints from a restaurant in a recognised establishment that charges a tidy sum.Thanks Churchill Arms, for turning the last 36 hours of our honeymoon into a 100m dash for the nearest latrine competition. Great job on the exterior of the building. Could you now turn your attention to the interior of the building? Specifically the area 'out the back' that passes itself off as a restaurant.

ldOcYbZJhL1tJbUNer9N5w.text: Was not impressed with the attitude of the establishment or the employee's. When we first arrived we were told we had one hour to eat, the waiter miscommunicated our order and when we tried to get his attention he told us one minute, kept walking and never returned. We had to ask another waiter for the menu to place another order.

CRX08DuVdXaPaTfsLcqF2w.text: Thai food at a pub? Don't be deceived by appearances! The Churchill Arms serves up an awesome Pad Thai for much less than most restaurants!The wait can be quite long in the evening, but they do takeaway if you walk right up to the counter in the back of the pub. The dining area is small, but you can sit in the pub area if it's full. I actually prefer to sit in the pub area because your eyes get to wander all the interesting things adorning the walls and ceiling.It's a quick walk from Notting Hill Gate tube station, so it's a great place to stop into if you've been up at Portobello Market.

TawUt3a8sP6U-xuDskvHtA.text: Had a great time here. My wife and I agree that this was the best meal we had during our London vacation.

IjAHcPWyyqdFCCqGsq731A.text: Really great experience from start to finish, great pub, fast service, and reasonable and delicious food.

BzUJBz4RYssNs2BMINarmw.text: Beers - GreatAmbiance - Fantastic - great outside/insideFood - I didn't want ThaiService - The guys were pretty young, and not knowledgeable about anythingIf there was a bar keep over 25, with somewhat a knowledge of the beers - 4 stars..

X_zzQgTZXoZDqDiUTFiQSg.text: An authentic and historic pub plus pretty good Thai food. I love combos.

EwlvCMQLTvgdGI7pPmK22w.text: As you can see the other posts, this pub hides a delightful secret a thai restaurant at the back! Run by a Thai native, it serves simple, but great thai food. The menu consists of rices dishes that come with curry or stirfry, or noodle dishes. For the adventurous, they have spicy jungle curry that will rival those found in Bangkok for its spiciness. Each dish is £6, and is very filling. Service is quick, and there is usually a queue to get a table on weekends or in the evenings. Drinks have to be ordered from the bar in the pub side. This is a place for when you want to have lunch or dinner with friends in a relaxing friendly atmosphere, and don't want to spend too much either!

UFjXTQl0EJmq2H5HaIRrKA.text: This pub a great photo opportunity, inside & out. And the surfeit of hanging baskets makes it the most attractive pub I've ever seen!   It also has a great tap and lots of comfy chairs.  But the most peculiar thing is that the pub is connected to a Thai restaurant.   I can just imagine the poor soul after a pint too many, who wanders off in the wrong direction in search of the bathroom finding himself in Thailand.   Definitely a sobering shock!

EzkrEPxFjRFCHWRjwRLnxw.text: Great, great recommendation from a local!Delicious and inexpensive thai food in the back section of a pub.  Lots of character (flowers and plants in every nook and cranny).  Fast service, which was good because upon being seated, our waitress informed us we could only have our table for one hour.

PfpK8BC6p_9DIsknsupdxw.text: I was in London for about 9 weeks and this was my favorite pub! Great Thai Food!! Egg Rolls and the Pad Thai! May have to wait with a big group, but you can just grab a pint in the front and they will come grab you!!

vAOBixZ8fu8WnXrWJ12Zww.text: A friend suggested me to check this place out. He was very positive that I will like it. Well, it's nice and it has character, and the staff was very friendly. However, the Thai restaurant in the back of th pub just made this place have a weird mixture of bad smells. Too strong. I wasn't too impressed.

IuScx7ksl1Gzl9KokA9Bag.text: One of my classmates has been obsessed with this place since the second day he got here. He made me curious, and passing the overly-flowered outside while walking to the Portabello Market and Notting Hill thrift stores made me want to go in there more. But, I don't go to pubs alone, so I had to wait until we could go together.Man, the wait was well worth it. We went in the afternoon when it was filled with disgruntled tourists and old ladies....perfect atmosphere for a weekday afternoon. Drinks were cheap and the Thai food was cheap, let alone delicious. Many places do duck curry wrong, but the portion was perfect and perfectly flavored, and they gave you enough rice to have the perfect rice/curry ratio. Good work, Churchill!

E5bhc9JV8lonbOxDST3B7Q.text: I thought I had reviewed this already.  Go here! it is without a doubt my favorite bar in London I only wish I had found it sooner.  For some reason it never feels cramped or hectic despite being very very busy.  Add to that the interesting decor and incredible thai food and whats not to love.  I can't for the life of me comprehend how much work must be involved in maintaining all those plants and flowers :-)

x_CQziAFFHK6BYu0Wqt-ww.text: Undoubtedly one of the prettiest pubs in London, with hanging baskets galore in the summer months and endless fairy lights come Christmas time. The interior is just as charming, although the hundreds of chamber pots hanging from the ceiling is a tad unnerving! Out the back there's a restaurant which serves Thai food. I've never eaten there but the restaurant area is wonderfully quirky, and feels like an indoor garden with water features and shrubbery wherever you turn. I'll report back once I've sampled some of the cuisine.

i-oU2aHRmReMB4p6kaD4vQ.text: The best Thai food in London (my opinion of course)! Food served quickly, hot, and so tasty! Great pub atmosphere with pints and wines. But the Thai food is something to brag about. Fun time, interesting bar setting, cool building (especially in the spring with all the flowers) and delicious food. Friendly bar and restaurant staff. Go! Go now!! If you're on Kensington High Street and you see a bunch of people walking, this is where they are going... follow them, you will have no regrets.

LhH8G7C8_lhzUd6lqHyx-g.text: This pub is really pretty, thats partly what made me want to try it, well that and the thai food. However this pub I feel is a victim of its own success, I went on a Wednesday night at it was rammed and impossible to get a table. However we did get a table in the restaurant but I found the food a let down, I love thai food and I like it spicy but the dish I had nearly blew my brains out. And the experience was quite rushed so I won't be returning.

EIzNiv-mvsh_YFHCEnHFGg.text: This review is just for the Thai restaurant attached to the pub and not for the pub itself (which I think is a bit too old manish).It serves the best Thai food in London bar none.You will probably have to wait a while for a table but it is worth it.The portions are large and the price is very good (you will not find cheaper in the area).Now if only they could move it out of that old geezers pub.

_IihB2pJqEPu7RcNdfxxpg.text: Very cool venue, tasty Thai food- what more could you really need?

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Looking up in the garden area

DVh4pqMNYyoqO3vVb7YomQ.text: Great atmosphere (homey).  Great crowd (equal age distribution between 20 and 60, and everyone gets along and converses).  Some of the best Thai food around (I always get #16 w/prawns).Great Fuller's ales.It has it all.  What else do you need?Oh, and it gets a bit more crowded during rugby matches....

xsRhsyHRpHzilxZumz1seA.text: Nice traditional pub atmosphere. Very crowded though. Very good thai food served at the back.

-ckwH6b05Q8zLyhTsuKKXA.text: I followed a Yelp recommendation here and was somewhat disappointed. Mediocre at best Thai food and very expensive drinks. Besides the flowers there's very very little to recommend here. Certainly not a #1 pick on any level.

Gw4z1Zg5jUjo5hX1-f7EDA.text: I was traveling solo and was looking for a tasty dinner. I was seated right away and told I could only take one hour to eat. Odd but I wasn't planning on staying longer than that. The decor is really interesting inside with lots of plants & vines hanging. It is very cozy and the food in the Thai restaurant in the back is really good. I didn't know what to order and looked for a review and ordered the chicken Pad Gai Himmayan mild (spelling?) and a Thai iced tea. I was extremely satisfied with my meal. I've had some of the best Thai restaurants in NY and can say the flavor was spot on. The service is quick but of course not very friendly but I think it's just a cultural thing.

Po373UVKCm42VPjX6n1o1A.text: Cool old pub. The bar section and exterior are kitschy on top of kitschy with a side of kitsch. There are tons of knick-knacks inside, and the outside is plastered with vegetation to the point it almost looks like a building is growing on the vines rather than the other way around. Hey, go big or go home, right? It's pretty cool looking, actually. We shared a gin and tonic and left, but it's worth a look if you're in the neighborhood.They also run a Thai restaurant in back, which sadly we did not try due to their being completely reserved a few days in advance. It's a hot ticket!

DT3snCh-k758ucU-SHQx5Q.text: This place is VERY cool. Eating here just to sit in their canopy of plants and lanterns and interesting decor is an experience in and of itself. But on to the goods - the food. We (my guy and me) have Thai food quite often in the States, at least once every two weeks. We both got different spice levels of Pad Thai, and I wouldn't recommend the very mild one - it is pretty plain. But, my partner in food had the mild level of spicy and it was very flavorful and tasty! The waiters aren't super friendly and the beer was warm, but I'd still recommend checking this place out (it is cooollll) even if it's just to have a beer. The front is actually a pub, so you don't HAVE to eat, you can always just drink!

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom

q3v2eDkeKEBYSjmh90fBVQ.text: Great beer, great Indian food and fantastic atmosphere. Bar staff could be a bit friendlier though. It can get pack quickly and unexpectedly so make sure to show up early. When you walk in, you must find your own table and grab your beer from the bar. You also have to go on the side of the pub (right) to order your Thai food. The will bring your food the the table.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom

MCb7iTy1R2HVQ7OTqNlAaQ.text: This place was soooo good. It was one of my top 5 for best food I've had in England. I was just looking for something close to my hotel but I got so much more. Food is flavorful and you get lots of it. The outside and inside is beautiful and there is tons of space. The front area is a bar and the back area is the restaurant. I got pad Thai and spring rolls. Both great for the value and had left overs. Service was just ok but the food makes up for it. Already planning to go back and bring friends.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom

uHc7jXR589pcsIC2u3qJNA.text: Based on reviews, I knew what to expect. The reviews are very accurate. The place gets crowded, so I took care to get there around noon. By 12:40, it was filling up fast. I ate in the front pub area. You go back to the restaurant area, about midway back, and order from a woman who serves as order-taker and cashier. Her demeanor is a cross between sadness, anger, and resignation. You indicate in the general area where you're sitting, and hope the server finds you. They do. I started with the fried spring rolls, six of them, accompanied by that pink-orange sweet-hot dipping sauce. The spring rolls are small and quite ordinary; even the sauce wasn't up to the task of saving them. My stir-fry (#11, with chicken) was hot in both temperature and spice. But it had a vague fish flavor to it, so much so that I reviewed the menu again to see if that was among the ingredients. No. I wistfully looked at the dishes being served to the neighboring tables; they all looked good. I'll try this place again (I enjoy pub interiors and the people who frequent them) but I'll try something else. The brewer's (Fuller) lager, Frontier, was a perfect accompaniment. I gave an extra star for the motley collection of toys and memorabilia on the ceiling, including a Focke Wulf fw190 chasing a Spitfire.

JzoIUaVsTwNn7Ww4wAo6-A.text: Such a unique place! We were sick of boring pub food, and we love Thai. When I saw this spot on Yelp we had to check it out. Great solid Thai food in a charming pub. I'd recommend this to anyone staying around Kensington!

-aQiZN065yLNwMufS3nFtA.text: This picturesque bar is a nice stop for a quick drink! We did not order food so I cannot comment on the food. The selection of beers & spirits will satisfy any pallet. My only qualm was the lackluster bar staff who were unwillingly to enter into any conversation and seemed like they didn't even want to be working together. At a "touristy" destination such as this one, I wished for more conversation from the staff.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom

ge4q3bT7BeM56bdijuWzJQ.text: Cheap Thai food in a nice British setting. Great for a quick bite and pint. Good taste and portions for the price. All dishes are ~9 pounds. The exterior is very pretty and worth a picture. A nice place to grab lunch before or after exploring Kensington palace / Notting Hill.We got the Jungle Curry and the Pad Ga Praow. Both on the very spicy side. I also got a passion fruit cider! Very refreshing and I would highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Jungle Curry - spicy.

qdy8Pslechqjw3jCMpoyuQ.text: The cutest building all covered in plants & flowers.  quite funny because it is half pub & half thai restaurant which is such a random mix. We enjoyed both sides! Sat at the pub one day during the rugby Six Nations match & came back the next night for some Thai food for dinner. At the Thai restaurant all the food was really tasty & had a good amount of spice.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Pad kra pow w/beef
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Prawn chips (recommend!!)
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom

fH13R4DY4YAMPYnLyljXoA.text: Let me start this off by saying I truly love Thai food - and have been to several Thai restaurants (in the area and in the states) Okay. I walk in, table for 2, they're busy but we're seated within 5 minutes. Much appreciated. Hostess was rude. Look, I know Asian culture, I get the language barrier, BUT the hostess was RUDE and she knew she was being rude. Server was slightly better. Food came out quick. I ordered pad Thai and pad kee Mo, with an order of spring rolls. Food was average. They didn't have Tom Kha soup and the server was extremely rude when I asked for Siracha. To summarize:Food: averageService: below averageAlso, they had 32 people crammed in one back room. That's just the one room in the back, the other rooms were even worse (didn't get a total count) There are better Thai restaurants in the area.

PsQJMLAUx6SnZHSKJA63pg.text: I found out about the Churchill Arms via Instagram. It's that picturesque pub that you see with tons of flowers outside. I was really only expecting to snap a quick picture outside and leave, but when my friends and I were in the area, needed a dinner place, and saw it had 4 stars, we decided to give this place a try. Plus, we were pretty sick of English pub food at this point, so Thai food was a welcome change. Speaking of Thai food, from the outside looking in, you would never guess it was Thai food. It was only through research that I learned this. I also learned that it can get pretty packed. So when we showed up on Friday night at about 8 pm, we thought that grabbing a table for three would be a feat. Luckily, the place is pretty big, they told us to look around, and we eventually found a table not too long after.I ordered the pad kee mao, which came out really quickly. It was SUPER spicy. TOO spicy for me, but this isn't the fault of Churchill Arms, as the dish is meant to be spicy. But, I couldn't eat the dish because my mouth was on fire and I got filled up on the water that was putting out the fire on my tongue. Could have used some Snow (Hey Yo). I got the rest to go and ate the rest later that night. I picked out all of the RHCP and it was great. The noodles were palatable again.Bottom line, you should definitely go to at least check out all of the flowers. But if you want to get a seat for some Thai food, don't go at prime dinner time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Pad see ew

cwpYeKDT-Vq9fcRBJTx3qg.text: Lovely from the outside so much fun on the inside.  We came during the World Cup and it was packed! We didn't have a chance to eat but it smelled delicious. Great place to enjoy a pint when around Kensington.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom

QKKT9GbxIHvEvWkVJkUKlQ.text: Okay. I am sorry this place is loved by so many people. I understand why the bar is famous, I get that part and it wowed me too. But the thai restaurant, it wasn't that good, actually it wasn't good at all. The place made me claustrophobic, the plants were too much, and then food in there with so many people sitting so close, the humidity , o am sorry but I didn't have a great experience. They tried to create it pretty and may be it is for some people. I personally didn't like it .Again, the bar was great and so was it's historic significance.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom

Hx-EKTaAPY0CWYA7S3dICg.text: A unique pub experience. Come for the unique environment, stay for the Thai food. Both are truly enjoyable.

kkYo5nVFrR5WICK5WNfeEw.text: I've been here twice already as a tourist that a local friend of mine recommended to me. You'll first notice the grandiose display of flowers out front which is certainly an eye catcher, but incredibly beautiful in my opinion! You'd never guess there's a Thai restaurant in the back of the pub and alas! There is. The first time I went, it was a group of 8 of us. A reservation was made and we had to wait about 35 minutes, but got seated. I know that the restaurant is small and I sensed that such a big group was a "burden" of sorts but we were taken care of. Albeit, quickly so they could open the table again , but it didn't matter to my friends as we were enjoying the company. I fell in LOVE with their sweet and sour chicken dish which was delightful yet affordable and a combination hard to find in my native Los Angeles. Because it was the end of the day, my group and I corralled at the front pub after we paid our bill. Some had pints they enjoyed, I did not. We had to split the group as there weren't tables big enough to accommodate, but we made most of the situation as people filtered out the later it got (it was a Monday night). The second time I went, it was a group of three on a Sunday during the Notting Hill Carnival so doubly packed in the pub, spilling out into the street. and we were served almost immediately with no problem as my friend made a reservation. I also have to give the 'Arms "props" for a lovely, clean washroom with a flower theme (as you can imagine). Delightful albeit crowded and loud, Churchill Arms is my recurring London spot to pop in to!

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Gorgeous exterior
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Sweet and sour chicken
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Pub area

ipFcrgyFICSR-FKxxWNrHg.text: We met a local friend here for a pint and it was amazing. The entire exterior of the pub was covered in live Christmas trees. It is literally the most festive place I've ever been. It was a bit crowded, even on a Monday night, but we enjoyed a glass of their mulled wine and then a pint. Another friend suggested we go to see them on Halloween as well. It was a pretty traditional pub on the inside with a very warm atmosphere. We would definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Outside the pub at Christmas.

2qxllMSud_fuQYcB_EjEjQ.text: I have to admit the initial reason for me coming to Churchhill Arms was initially based on all the exterior pictures posted to various travel websites,  showing a vast array of flowers and plants spilling over from windowsills and down the walls made it look like the quintessential British pub. The interior is actually bigger than it looks, but made to feel cozy with walls that a filled to the brim with various pictures, knickknacks and greenery throughout. A warning though, this place is very popular and wait times should be expected, but between the bar and nearby shopping, the wait time doesn't seem too long. The restaurant has a great selection of beers and wines that pair well with the Thai menu. The portions here are huge, so you could easily share a dish between two people. Everything is made to order and the degree of spiciness for each dish is listed on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom

rbnDrJNSFqjp3BBjMaFC5Q.text: My favorite restaurant in the world. The best Thai food I've ever eaten - I always get the panang curry. The butterfly garden atmosphere, the rustic decorations inside and the flowers covering the outside mean that this is one of the happiest spots I've ever been to. Love it so much, this is the place I tell EVERYONE they must stop by when they visit LDN.

b7K4WVAwgikGBgyht80kyg.text: I love how unique this restaurant is! It's covered with an insane amount of plants inside and out. When we came the place was packed! Clearly a hit with the locals. The inside is dark and has a very distinct damp mildew smell (because of all the plants). Once you get over the smell it's really a unique atmosphere. For dinner we had the spring rolls and pad siew. Both were absolutely delicious! Good potions too!

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Pad siew - great
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Spring rolls - great

icsVjdypWclGJSOG1FukzQ.text: A two-for-one deal - kitschy, famed pub with a Thai resto in the back! Besides being a spectacle of history, it's overwhelmingly pretty as well. The show-winning flowers that spill overtop of Kensington Church Street and the hanging tropical conservatory inside create a display to admire. And as if the atmosphere weren't enough, it's backed up by some great Thai food in the city. Offering decent flavors at an affordable price, it's a win-win all around.  (Note: Judging from the mixed reviews, you either love or hate this place, but it's worth finding out.)

RiWKztwnvQWn7IkjlSfDQw.text: Went here last night with my parents who are over in the UK to visit. We are staying in a hotel in Kensington so it was a quick walk from are hotel to this restaurant/pub. Kind of funny since its both a Thai restaurant and an English Pub but I really like it. They have tons of plants inside the restaurant part which I thought was really cute and made for a kind of rain-forest atmosphere. You can walk through the pub and sit in the back at a restaurant or you can sit in the pub and order from the bar. I rather liked the restaurant more because I got to sit there and have a proper catch up session with my parents. You order beers from the bar when you sit down in the resturant so you get the best of both worlds.We got the Pad Thai, the Duck Curry, and this really yummy rice dish  with pork and onions and bell peppers. All were really good at the bill for the food only came about £19  which was really good for all of us.The only reason they did get a 4 star was because There was a hair on the edge of one of the plates which is ughhhh.... not COOL. But I really like this place.... just not the hair....

KWGcQmVezRef_By44Mgqtw.text: Best Pad thai I've had, ever.Surely, the idea of opening the wall between the pub and the thai restaurant was risky but turned out brilliantly.Also, the deco is really nice, with old kettles hanging from the ceiling.Nice atmosphere and service as well.

1Bfal9fKUnp9ZA1x5ZuRMQ.text: After being one of the top rated restaurants near my hotel (Hilton on Bayswater), I decided to give it a shot and headed out into the spring showers. My first impressions were extremely positive. Arriving a little after 4pm on a Sunday, I expected the place to be empty. Boy was I wrong! I barely was able to get a table and the bar was two deep. Going in the back, there's a beautiful seating area filled with live plants.I ordered a glass of Merlot (okay) and spring rolls to start. The spring rolls were decent and plentiful (6 total). The service was good, as far as Thai restaurants go. Fairly quick, which wasn't surprising since there's an hour max on the tables (that's what she told me). However, right after I ordered that, I proceeded to wait for over 30 minutes for my pad thai. Which, unfortunately, was very mild when I asked for hot and spicy. Also, funny how a couple sat down next to me, ordered, and got their food in 15 minutes.OverallGood: atmosphere, the bar, wine selectionBad: very average food, unpredictable wait times

H79LsCuxDOl_I_UdiRvH8w.text: Wonderful location, and delicious food.  Can't be beat!  Picture this: stuffy pub with taxidermy and flea market bric-a-brac everywhere, couple of paces, and voila: a butterfly conservatory garden with potted flowers hanging everywhere.  Churchill Arms, a sly fox with a gem of a restaurant tucked within.  This review is for the Thai restaurant in the conservatory.1. Food:  Delicious, and hearty portions.  Had the pad thai and the pad see ew, both highly delicious.  A tad bit on the sweet side, but not complaining.  This and Busaba Eathai are my favorite Thai places.2. Service:  Pleasant and efficient.3. Atmosphere: Cute, charming, and quaint.  Would make for a cheap date place or a meal with the girls / family.

22LuiwH56jA5MBLqGBZCcw.text: Amazing decor. Food is alright, but this place has an awesome atmosphere. It looks like a kleptomaniac decorated the pub with all their collections and then decided to spice things up by serving traditional Thai food. I'd definitely come back!!

lmrllPqRWtqpYSvINW_19A.text: Great quiet little boozer with nice bitters, easy vibe, and plenty of classic old kitsch to set the mood.  Spent a couple of good hours here with a good old friend shooting the proverbial shizzy.  Great place to do so.  Plus, I didn't eat but the place smelled like there was some fantastic food cooking up.  Wish I'd have eaten here instead of the crappy fish n chip joint I went to.

orlCluyQMCq8uj-eaWjGaw.text: I really wanted to love this Pub/ Restaurant. It is a traditional pub with OK beer, so so food (I went to the loo more than considered regular for days after...mmmm)  and OK staff.It has a separate restaurant that serves Thai food. Good for separation of eaters and drinkers. The portions are decent. None of that itsy bitsy poncey food rubbish.I love the fire place and the roof clutter. The Churchill memorabilia is pretty educational too :-)I particularly had the following niggles:1. Maybe it is because I was there with my friends on a Saturday but should that be an excuse for rubbish service. Really? Really? Waiting staff rudeness is just so arghhhhh.2. I know, flowers are great, lovely and all that but there is such a thing as too much. On my way to the loo, I had to traverse a veritable jungle with water features (the works!) and nearly slipped on a few wet petals lying around the stone floor.Not good for your mood if you are a stone-cold sober pregnant women in a pub sipping on cranberry juice with a slice of lemon (yum!) when everyone around you is drinking special apple juice and beer.

cs4wHVZuJJj4YsX76UVGqQ.text: I was here, quite drunk, the thai food was nice.The noodle dishes were fine, but the curry plates were quite small, be warned.The pub was a pub, nice enough crowd.

EEPzD3XEqn1zU4vXHEQ5Eg.text: The Thai red curry was hot and tasty. Pad Thai was also great. Even more remarkable is the atmosphere. Bric-a-brac literally on every wall, ceiling and any other bare surface. Very memorable!

UpL_ztStI7HlC79RBi2IAg.text: Delicious Thai food tucked away under the guise of an English pub.Pad Siew was delicious and had cabbage, peppers, and peas, adding some nice vegetables.  My friends ordered the tiger curry and the #5 (beef stirfry) which was amazing!  Interesting space too, loaded with fresh flowers/plants. Almost felt like being outdoors.

g5R1SiJWYEocGlPCjKnsPA.text: Ok, this place is awesome.You walk in the front, looks like a traditional English pub.... (the ceiling decorated entirely with bed pans. Lots of cool WWII and other memorabilia to look at. BUT!You go through the pub to the back, and through this door SUDDENLY YOU ARE IN A MAGIC GARDEN OF THAI GARDEN EXPLOSION (or something like that). It is a secret hidden thai restaurant, and that is awesome on its own. And it really is like one big overgrown garden, in suck start contrast to the Pub facade and front bar.AND more importantly, the food was affordable (most if not all dishes under £7) and plentiful (my friend and I ordered a prawn crackers, panang-type curry (#20) and Pad See Ew, and we didn't finish it all (a rare occurrence for me). It was hot and good. I'm happy, I just wish it was closer to where I live.The one weird thing was that they wouldn't take our £20 note because it was one of the older ones the banks are phasing out. We had other cash, but we thought that was ridiculous. Money is money and it was really stupid they wouldn't take it.

DUor5CbUdp8hFWTittxKkQ.text: Winston would be proud.There is much to like about the Churchill Arms:  The warm, cozy atmosphere.  The kind and friendly wait staff.  The spectacular choices of ales, lagers and ciders.  And tucked in the back is some of the finest thai food you'll find outside Bangkok.  All the noodle dishes pack a punch on the spice meter and the rice dishes are worth trying too.  Each time I dine here I order a plate of their perfectly cooked spring rolls.   I strongly recommend the Churchill Arms for a casual dining and drinking experience.Pros: beer selection, authentic thai food served by thai peopleCons: need a booking during peak hours.  Otherwise, prepare to wait.

6NinUs8g-up__MzfT_pW-Q.text: One day in 3 it rains in Britain. I walked with an umbrella (which in fact I always carry with me) down Kensington Church Street to a pub.  In summer the pub is buried beneath an abundance of flowers and has won an award 'Boozer In Bloom' at Chelsea Flower Show! Finally arriving at the destination I was soaked in rain and couldn't wait to order a red wine.I entered a pub, which could not been more English. It was cluttered up with memorials and you wont be disappointed, there is also a picture of Winston Churchill accompanied by a selection of other gentlemen such as of American Presidents, British Premiers and a good number of British Royals. A varied group of clientele queued up at the bar to order a pint or two or three. At the Churchill Arms you order the drinks from the bar while as you order the food from the Thai restaurant, which is placed at the back of the restaurant- Apparently, it is a converted garage. There you find yourself in middle of a tropical garden, flowers have been planted and butterfly images hang on the wall.Be aware not to be given a table unless your whole group of friends have arrived. Due to its popularity the tables take turn every hour. The Thai restaurant reasonably priced food, I believe, is its major attraction. Pad Thai with prawns is my recommendation to start a night out.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. The impressive flower vegetation of Churchill Arms

ni41V9T3YpwuoNSzZ_VBVw.text: Amazing Thai food!  Warning, though, when it has three butterflies on the hotness indicator, that means it is seriously hot!  The green chicken curry is my fav, with two butterflies on the hotness scale.  The red curry with either beef, chicken, or prawns is very nice as well, but not as spicy hot as the green.  In addition to the Thai food, the Sunday roast is terrific as well.  A humongous plate of food.  My husband got the roast beef and I got the roast lamb.  Tender slices of meat with gravy, roast potatoes, carrots, green peas, and cabbage.  We lived in London for 2 years (05-07)and ate here at least three times a week.  Gerry the owner is a great barkeeper, the staff are well trained, and at the Thai restaurant you could not ask for nicer staff.After being gone for 5 or so years, we just returned for a holiday with our friends and it felt wonderful to be not only recognized but hugged by the Thai staff members and some of the regular patrons.  This place is a "crown jewel" with trinket prices in a posh part of town.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. A charming night at the bar

BQotdAFfCO8NIVkiuqHf-g.text: I lived in this part of London for years and have been to the Churchill Arms quite a few times. It has an eccentric (read 'precious') feel, with things dangling from the walls. The clientele is older, particularly during the day, and it can be challenging to find a section of the pub where there is not a strong draft from the weather outside...However, the atmosphere is strangely charming, and the beer choices wonderful. The Thai restaurant in the back does better take-away (in my opinion) - you'll avoid the painful wait... portions are American-sized and tasty.Churchill Arms does this neighborhood proud

Glrf-lO3n2gy-jzuXglpag.text: If I was more swayed by atmosphere and decor, I'd give this a five.  A busy pub setting, with low ceilings, an odd array of decorations, and enough plants to feel like a greenhouse.  But the food was just not there for me.  Maybe I set the bar high for Thai, as I've enjoyed some good ones, but it was all just a little bit cloying.  I'm probably being a touch harsh.  It was decent, and I wouldn't say never, but definitely not worth a 4.

F3ueRPFeGPiU4ALOn4Zktw.text: Surprisingly good Thai food served in an authentic British pub with fair prices.  The servers try hard but communication can be difficult especially given the fairly high decibel noise level

FLPszSGDKKAykGKqHJKchQ.text: So I come here on my first day in london expecting a good Thai Meal based on the reviews.....contrary to my belief, the food was horrible. Then I ordered Pad Thai noodles and the smell that came frim the plate was atrocious. ....when asked if I could replace my order, I was told I still had to pay for the dish I didnt eat. Unbelievable.  I will never return, nor did I order another dish. Horrible customer service.

MhzRHengSNE1Cvny7RzZSw.text: Y'know Little Shop of Horrors?  Well, this pub is nothing like it, except for the plants/ the plants/ the running theme of plants.  Lots of plants everywhere - woo hoo.  Imagine the exterior all covered in little potted Christmas trees - Weyhey!  Fun, come in and what do we find?More theme, Churchill (yeah, he was good wannhe?), real ales (nice, not to expensive, nice), atmosphere on tap (make mine hushed and tranquil, so not great on a Friday night) and Thai restaurant out back.  You gotta have 'em these days.  I didn't eat there, though interestingly, I do like Thai food...I just stopped in to sup an ale, that was it, and for that, it want all bad.  But really, I found these themes, a bit hard to swallow.  Thanks Churchill, I suppose it's 'cause of him we're able to be so damn ironic... in some way shape or form...

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. exterior

R1rJFjQZIjNSM5uYIXxIAQ.text: Went in for a quick drink before lunch and was immediately overwhelmed by the stench inside. Is it the carpet? Or is it the 'decorations' hanging from the ceiling? I have no idea, but you'll adapt and get used to it in 10 anyway. Tacky decor throughout affected the experience further. Had a London Pride and it tasted quite alright, kinda like a light beer. My taste buds felt satisfied but my other senses did not.

6F4pfYKfBvbRWfyK3007Lg.text: This isn't any ordinary pub as it's been drawing foodies craving a Thai fix from all over town. The pub area alone is quite nice with a fully stocked bar, a wide range of beers and ales on tap and bottle, and plenty of seating around including a fairly large outdoor terrace when the weather is favourable. But the Thai food is really what draws the crowds because, quite simply, the staff and kitchen look like they've been taken straight from Thailand. These guys and gals are no-nonsense and all about the food. It does feel a bit like you've stepped into the streets of Bangkok as they quickly usher you to a table, push you for an order, and then within minutes your food has arrived. Add that to the slightly hot and humid setting with the smell of fresh flowers in the air and you can close your eyes and escape the City for a little while.The Pad Thai was delicious with supple noodles in the classic lime and peanut sauce bursting with fresh clean flavours. It had the taste of a dish made to order rather than en masse and spooned out as needed. I'd easily rate it as one of the best Pad Thai's in London if not in my experience to date. On the spicy dishes, each was well executed with tender meats, crunchy veggies, and a boatload of chilli flavour (despite there being relatively few chillies in the dish). Even the most leather tongued veteran at our table had to admit the heat was there in spades and more than a few of us broke out in hiccups. Yet it wasn't all fire with a solid depth of flavours shining through so that the heat enhanced rather than overwhelmed the food.With main dishes being around £7-9 and each one a pretty hefty portion, it's brilliant value. Hell, a meal here costs less than the average cocktail at the bars/clubs just down the street.

gq_u5hYRjVA2NweNfVfv0A.text: I came for the beer,  stayed for the food, and left cos of the service. As advertised, quirky Thai restaurant in an old Fuller's pub. You get the usual range of Fuller's beer on cask - ordered a London Pride and ESB without even referring to the bar. The food is more than decent - possibly as authentic as you can get in London. Flavours are very, very close to authentic, although a touch sweeter and possibly a little less spicy than what you get in Thailand (I've not really had a lot of very spicy food in Thailand - that said I have quite a high tolerance for spice, higher than some Thais even). I had the green curry, missus had basil pork. Meat was a bit overcooked, and I missed having Thai fig in my curry. Still, convincing enough for me. The service though, is quite appalling. I've been to Thailand, and they don't call it the land of a thousand smiles for nothing. Nary a smile from the Thai wait staff from the moment I entered, til I left. Was brusquely informed that we had one hour to eat. Thankfully we knew what we wanted, and ordered quickly. Being relatively hungry and spice-resistsnt, we polished off our meals in short order, and settled down to make the best of our measly hour. Throughout my meal, the staff were gesticulating at us and plotting table arrangements, ostensibly conducting an academic exercise on how to accomodate more imaginary guests. At the 45th minute, we were served our bill without word. And at the 60th minute, we were perfunctorily requested to move to the bar area if we wished to continue drinking - I still had half a pint of ESB. This was despite the house being less than half full in my estimation. Look, I've been to Thailand. I know that the Thai people are capable of embarrassing levels of hospitality and politeness. I've experienced it many times. This was really a very poor reflection of the establishment, and of the Thai people. The beer is good, the food is great but the service is just a mess. I'm not coming back here again.

UpEylItfdsWa9KOKBzgyFA.text: Came in for a quick dinner and pint before meeting some friends in Notting Hill. Overall, they serve pretty good but highly westernized Thai food in a cool pub setting. Other reviewers have already given a good overview of the atmosphere, so I'll skip right to the food. My husband and I shared three dishes: pad gra pao with beef, pad kee mao (often translated as drunken noodles, but not here) with prawns, and jungle curry with beef. We requested our dishes - especially the gra pao, Thai spicy. The server insisted, "It's already Thai spicy." I asked if the kitchen could make it spicier than they usually did, and he insisted again, "Already very, very spicy! We do not change the taste at all from the way they do it in Thailand."OK. It is what it is. I crossed my fingers. I am an unabashed chile head. When I eat most Thai food, I want to sweat and sneeze, I want to wish for cucumbers and vanilla ice cream to make it all cool down, I want to burn baby burn. But most Londoners don't want that, so I was skeptical of the server's claims. The dishes arrived, and I was crestfallen to find that they barely had any heat. To be fair, all three got the non-fiery flavor components basically correct: the curry especially had beautiful complex layers of flavor. My one complaint about the gra pao was they majorly skimped on the basil - that's one of the things that annoys me the most about Thai food in the U.S. and Europe - they often skimp on herbs. We asked the server for more chilies for our dishes. At first, he was reluctant, but finally brought us some. Finally, satisfaction! And the dishes paired well with the Fullers real ale they had on cask.When we went to pay, the server told us, "Next time, tell us you've been here before, and we will give you properly spicy food. We've had issues in the past with customers requesting Thai spicy, and then sending back the dishes because they were too spicy." Lovely. Typical culinary bravado. I've seen it with meat too - people requesting steaks "blue" and then expecting them cooked to a level I'd consider medium rare or even medium. People, it is OK to want mild Thai food or a medium rare steak (though if you go more than that, you're dead to me - the cow has already been killed - no need to add the insult of mediumness or well-doneness to the injury of slaughter). It is fine not to want to cry from the capsaicin burns while eating curry, people! However, if you don't want that, do not request Thai spicy! And if you do order it that way, and it's too spicy, tough. Suffer through it. Because if you whine or send it back, you are ruining things for the rest of us. Restaurants are refusing to give us our heat because of chickenhawks like you. So man up or shut up. Rant over. In sum, this place definitely worth a stop if you are in the neighborhood. Not worth a trek all the way across London, but definitely worth it if nearby. Can't beat the prices - can have dinner for under a £10 without alcohol. They keep you moving, too - we were in and out in under an hour, which was good as we were running late to meet our friends. But until they know you, they will withhold the good stuff, or at least the hot stuff!

gBbWYiVbT2HDA_6FP857yg.text: I've been here before for a catch up with friends and loved the food, so I decided to come back with my family when we were in the area. There were 5 of us, we were seated on a 4 person table, and ordered 5 drinks, 2 main courses and 2 sides. We were going for dinner later on so didn't want to be too full! We were seated by the most bad tempered woman who got really annoyed and told us that we hadn't ordered enough food so she needed us to vacate our seats. "So you're kicking us out?!" "Yes. I have to kick you out". We left! We left within 10 minutes, still hungry. Such terrible customer service, won't be bringing anyone back here again.

mwHPoqH1jcXWNErEbA0Etw.text: The ambience and decor of this restaurant is very unique and elegant.  The pub is always a popular hangout.  The food here is decent and above average with highlights being the Spring rolls, pad Thai, and green curry.  Prices very reasonable for London.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Pad Thai
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Green curry!!!! One of their most popular dishes if you can handle very spicy...
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Spring rolls (but note that they are "egg rolls" to Americans)

46SuAUS-dTQRh4KY3Qcjuw.text: Crappy Thai food, very standard beer selection, outstanding florals, excellent brick-a-brac.

l4dUwssAcZM2EefyLWP8uw.text: This pub gets crowded quite quickly, and for good reason: beer and Thai food. What more could you want?OK, there isn't a huge beer selection, so don't come expecting a wide variety. You'll most likely be choosing from the usual Fuller's choices. Still, it has to be better than Greene King!As far as the food goes, you probably know not to expect your general pub grub since it serves Thai. It's not very upscale food, to be honest, but it's pretty good value for money (and quick!). So if you're ever fancying a quick, budget Thai, this is a great choice.You'll probably want to make reservations for food, or go extremely early and try to eat fast so they can fit in those who have made reservations. I have had the Pad Thai and the Pad Kee Mau. The former has pretty good flavour for the cost, and the latter nearly brought me to tears. That's a great thing when you're looking for spicy food!The other thing I like about this place is the atmosphere and the interior. It's kinda crazy with all the hanging plants and the collection of figurines spread out all over the pub. But it's entertaining and not at all boring to look around in.So do try The Churchill Arms out, not for high-end pub grub, but for a casual outing that just needs good, comfort Thai food and pints of beer.

vI5n-c0lc3rBQrtWMyYBlA.text: The Churchill Arms scores highly for its distinctive foliage-strewn appearance and interior, good value Thai food but less for its mixed quality service and comparatively bland Fullers beer.Indeed, in many respects I feel the same as Steve B about the Churchill Arms. I love the zany appearance of this pub, which apparently has earned it many a title from the London in Bloom competition. I also salute it continuing inside, with a veritable hanging garden of Babylon suspended above diners' heads in the incorporated Thai restaurant. And the food is certainly good value at £7.50 plus rice etc.However, the 1 hour maximum table policy grates, as does - as with Steve B's experience - the pointed slamming down of the bill while we were still half-way through our mains. Plus the Fullers beer, though dependable, is slightly behind the craft beer times that we live in when it comes to quality.Still, definitely worth visiting for its highly unusual appearance alone.

aPMN6S19oobhGFzrL6OJ-Q.text: I didn't like one bit. Disgusting food (not even close to Thai food in any possible way) and really slow service. It was really crowed. It's of course a beautiful place, but that's not what matters when it comes to restaurants.Never coming back

a_iCsGdv1RXbHTnqWrR0Og.text: Wow, I can't believe such a difference between my experience at the Churchill Arms and those who gave it 4 or 5 stars!We were recently visiting London, and while walking around the Kensington Palace area we saw the Churchill Arms.  We were immediately enamored of the wonderful exterior and decided we must go in.  Plus we were thirsty anyways from all the walking around.  This was mid-week, in the mid-afternoon.So, as we walk in the door, the very first thing that hit us was the odor.  Not good, a mixture of old musty damp smell combined with the aroma of urine.  Half our party of four was about to turn around and walk right out, but the other thirstier half said "come on, just one beer".  The place was not crowded, there were about 12 or so people scattered around the front area.  So we sit at a table, and notice it's filthy.  Ask the girl behind the bar to clean the table, and after a bit of a glare she did wipe it off.  We get our beers and sit down.   And notice the whole place is not very clean....the carpet, the chamber pots hanging from the ceiling in need of a good dusting, etc.   And the smell, it just didn't go away.We skipped trying the food, gulped our beers, and left.  Never ever to return again.

yr9pzBvCzI1o4SIpYUHAuA.text: I came upon this restaurant by sheer luck and fortune, and boy am I glad I can add this place to my box of memories!As a hobbyist being a Thai food critic, it must have been fate that my gang and I stepped into the Arms. Outside, the building is anything but unassuming. It is layered with natural greenery, and sticks out from the other buildings like nothing you have ever seen in the heart of London. But, it is hardly what one would expect to see as a Thai restaurant, since the facade is entirely modeled like a pub. And upon entering, the pub scene is only intensified. The lighting is so low, that it makes following the hostess to the table a chore in itself, but that only adds to the charm. As you walk through the seating areas, you will be visually bombarded with so many decorations that hang both from the walls and ceilings; do not be surprised if a plant vine, or old fishing net gets tangled in your hair as you proceed. Once seated, I remember our waiter being very patient and attentive, despite the tightly packed and busy evening he was encumbered with. When our dishes arrived, we all gladly devoured our plates within a few minutes. Stopping only to sip and talk over our drinks. After a 12+ hour day exploring London with my backpacker pals, this was just the place we needed to stop. The piping hot, delicious food and added environment made this restaurant a perfect end to a perfect day. The only issue I had (which is entirely subjective), is that I ordered my dish Hot, and it ended up being quite mild, so I asked for extra chilli and hot sauce, which the waiter promptly brought out. I would highly recommend this place to any of my acquaintances.

RAndybS9GKFUU7gdrrFPlg.text: We tried to eat at this restaurant the other evening and we were sent away from the dining area 30 minutes before the restaurant closed. The waitress said the table was reserved for someone else but we waited to see if the table was taken after the restaurant closed and it never had people arrive. We also watched another couple be seated by a restaurant employee only to see the same women turn them away. I have a feeling that they chose to tell us that so the kitchen could close on time. I am ok with that, but the waitress who told us was extremely rude and I had to ask her to quiet her voice.     The exterior is beautiful and the ambiance is an incredible location for dinner. Book a reservation to help avoid this issue.

xoKtIA145o7g466M6QF61A.text: The Churchill Arms...... how do I describe this interesting eclectic place.Well there are three aspects to this place.1-The outside setup of the hanging flowers on the walls outside.2-The pub3-The Thai restaurantI think the flowers outside are beautiful and eye catching, I think that how everyone end up inside that place when they're passing by.The Pub is a cool pub with an eclectic collection of things just hanging from the ceiling or where ever they can fit or hang! You can have the Thai food on the pub area tables if you go to the food area order and pay, they'll find you after that.The Thai food area was very interesting and another masterpiece of plants and flowers. As for the Thai food its self I really dont know what everyone is raving about. Maybe i jsut ordered a bad dish, Pad thai and to be honest it didn't taste like anything and the Noodles were mushy.The experience and the service earned them my 3 stars

CzLMrF5Y_0AEC4mSIOvPRQ.text: I love this place! The unusual combination of a classic pub and a Thai restaurant appears to be one of those happy accidents that works for some inexplicable reason. Maybe it's the bric-a-brac from British history hung on the walls and suspended from the ceilings. Maybe it's because the Thai food is some of the best that we've ever had. Whatever the reason, it is a great spot.

QVrw0M8mV4goXapabWUAEg.text: Amazing place. Beautiful flowers that really contribute to setting the ambiance. The whole decor is very quirky I would say. The Thai food is very good.Overall, I'd say this is a great spot to go to if you're in London. Good for going with a group of friends.Highly Recommend.

isQIlPMIwjRaOBLHhjQLdQ.text: Authentic. Authentic. Authentic. Weird in a authentic British pub huh? That's what I thought when my co worker suggested I go there while in London, as I am insane about Thai. The place is in a killer quaint area in west London, and has all the typical features of a traditional British pub, including the guinness flowing. You make your way through a dim lit bar/lounge area and head to the back. There is a gracious sweet Thai lady there to seat you.They have this super small intimate area in the back where they serve up delicious authentic Thai dishes, at a very fair price. Lanterns and ferns hanging across the entire ceiling make you feel like you are in a wonderland.My wife and I always share pad Thai and a curry of some sort, so here was no different. She got the pad Thai and I ordered the red curry with roasted duck, yes, roasted duck. It was amazing.If you are in London, this is an absolute MUST dining destination.

PlkSjJ1YfqrBv9Ee3f4MFw.text: OMG!  This place is magical.  The Thai restaurant in the rear is lovely and I'd dine there again in a second.  We just strolled in, told of the 1 hour seating limit, and then watched as the tables quickly filled up around us.  We quickly realised we were very lucky to have gotten a table.  The food was good and cheap.  We ordered drinks at the bar in the pub (not sure how much) but for an appetiser and two mains it was less than £20.  The location was great and the appearance is adorable.  There were so many people just taking pictures of the exterior.  Great staff, great food, great place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom

VSO5ujHFpAnGtn0AcjjmhA.text: Decent beer and cider with a fun ambiance! We had the cashew chicken and pad see u with beef which were both very tasty. Service was lacking but not horrible.

XZjD4JRCUawzaw-U3JKkKQ.text: Walking down Kensington Church Street with a growling tummy is no fun, until you spot the ever so magnificent Churchill Arms. This pub is definitely a sight. I've never seen so many flowers on a building in my life. They are everywhere; I mean how do they even water all of them.A few happy snaps later, and we are seated inside this pot plant, where the decor is just as flowery as it is outside. It feels like you are sitting in a greenhouse. There are flowers and pots and all type of living plants everywhere. And for such a style pub, you are served Thai food. Amazing Thai food at that!The service was fast and friendly, and the meals were a great size for the price. The atmosphere is incredible, and really makes this place a fun restaurant to meet with friends.

Q4Z786l_gdRXMcQC5B1DKQ.text: I've only ever come here on Friday & Saturday nights craving great a pint or two andThai food, and it delivers.The pub is always busy on the evenings on weekend, and quite small. The Thai restaurant attached serves a good range of simple Thai food at great prices. Lots of weird kitchy memorabilia on the walls, and a full range of beers & drinks available. Very hard place to resist if you happen to be walking up or down Kensington church st.

Jy4RyFkcCUpt3-6x6W_80Q.text: This place is amazing!! Thanks to yelp my wife and I stumbled in while wondering around notting hill. The Thai food wasn't the best in the world but the ambiance in the garden setting was unreal! We also had some proper English pints and had good service. Overall it was a great stop and I would recommend it to anyone!

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Some pints and Thai food!

25xw69DtmIUFtzbsblufeg.text: Here's a great cozy (read:small / tight spaces) restaurant with a thai restaurant. You need to make a booking to eat inside the restaurant. Or you can finagle your way to a table in the bar, and place an order with the restaurant host who will deliver the food to your table.Restaurant: Not too large but they push the tables to get the people in and it seats maybe more than the bar itself. Standard thai menu. Food is a 4/5. I will say, one of our dishes was labeled spicy and it was hot as heck. I can handle spice but this was so hot, each bite burned my mouth and I couldn't take more than 4 bites. My dining companion managed to eat more of it but was sweating the entire meal.We ordered a bottle of wine and around the one hour mark, was brought our check and told we had to finish up. Listen, in America we understand not taking a table for multiple hours but if we have half a bottle of wine left that we purchased at your establishment and we were never told our booking was strictly one hour, that's just rude. We pushed off the 'you must go' for 15 minutes, drank what I could stomach (on a burned mouth) and left some vino at the table.As for the bar, always pretty packed. Low tables and stools. Must order at the bar. Great that one can get thai food while enjoying some brews.I know my review probably sounds more like a 2 star, but really, i do like this place. Just be ready for some spicy food and potentially not nice service in the restaurant. The food and joint is good enough to stand up to it.

Hbvfs563nZK_DiIouCYALw.text: Guinness Extra Cold FTW!It has a stunning exterior.  Otherwise it is just another pub in a very lovelly part of London.  I will definitely go back and send friends to check it out.  The flowers are amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. What an amazing pub.

epcPnD19K_CfFTczflvuPg.text: Love this pub. Great setting with trinkets and books and pictures and newspaper articles all over the place (genuinely all over the place, there's random stuff galore hanging from every inch of the ceiling). We just had a couple of drinks but a friend got some food. This pub has a Thai restaurant running out of it, the food looked fab and if you want to sit in a more restaurant style setting then there's a gorgeous conservatory space out the back full of plants and flowers and tables for meals.

kOI0Kf14R32EmRIGtzl6_Q.text: This is a Thai pub/restaurant.My hubby had heard of it, and we'd decided to walk more than two miles to get to it. We are still happy with this decision.There is a one-hour limit to dinner service, so don't order too much food. We got a curry and another dish, and both were the perfect size for sharing.I believe that the curry is probably the best we've ever had. It was so fresh and clean and filled with amazing Thai flavors. Both the dishes were winners, and we're planning a return trip before our departure home.The two dishes we ordered were a level one and level two in heat. We will go with level three and four when we go back. The heat level was alright, yet we love our food really hot, so are more than happy to amp it up a notch or two.If you're seeking genuine, clean, Thai food, then The Churchill Arms is your place. I find it difficult to believe that you'd be disappointed.

00RsrEcAVkEADS_WCP4H1Q.text: Absolutely loved the visual here! We stopped in because of the history, and just for drinks! The place was mobbed, standing room only and a game was on. You could tell this is a local place to hang out. So glad it was recommended to us. Service at the bar was quite friendly, and speedy considering how busy they were. We walked into the back restaurant to see the foliage and flowers! Really cute and unusual place. Loved it. Would return!

aVH-E_bbjf4rtMnm2bRJvw.text: This was my favorite place for food and drinks while on vacation in the UK. I love beer and Thai food and this place has both under one roof! My husband and I spent time at the bar as well as in the dining area.The bartenders and servers are friendly and attentive. There's a good selection of beers on tap and you can even try samples before ordering. The food was great. When we ordered the Pad Kee Mao, we were warned about the spice level, but we love spicy food so we gave it a try. They weren't messing around - it was quite spicy but delicious!I would definitely come back next time I'm in the area.

ewZfyuOL9N2D6pvMzEidqw.text: This was such a nice change of pace from traditional pub food. My boyfriend and I came across The Churchill Arms while searching for a spot to grab lunch in London. Both of our dishes were delicious - he had the Pad Tai with chicken, and I had the Pad Siew with beef. Note: the pub side does not serve food, you need to be asked to be seated in the restaurant.Even if you aren't hungry, it's worth popping in for a pint just to see the unique decor.
