OKv9EUV91XpDEyGYRZW7xw.text: My partner and I went to Churchill Arms on a recent trip to London, and overall, I found that it was a very quaint pub mixed with a pretty good Thai restaurant.We sought out and went to Churchill Arms explicitly because this is one of my partner's favorite pubs in London. You walk in and it's just like any other pub, but very homey. It was packed in the drinking area, and it seemed like the place that always was packed. That's understandable, considering its location right by the Kensington Gardens.You walk through the actual pub area, and it's almost like you're transported to a different world with palm trees and patio furniture. Originally, didn't know what to expect because when you think of a traditional British pub, a Thai food place run by Thai people doesn't exactly come to mind. We both ordered some food so that I could try it out, and I was impressed with the offerings (though I don't remember the actual dishes). I had something they labeled as very spicy, but I don't feel it was a spicy as they said it would be. The waiter recommended a good Czech beer that went along with food, and I was glad to find a random European beer that went along with the Asian food.Ultimately, I had a really good time at Churchill Arms. I could look at the contrast between a traditional pub and a Thai restaurant as a plus or negative, but I just enjoyed it for what it was. I didn't to get to sit in the pub area in front (and the Thai food isn't allowed in that area), but that also looked like a fun spot.

IRW-vtISdjDUXpy9gX6VYA.text: V. Charming and quaint. Non-Londoners and tourists - this is a "must visit". This is as good as it gets for a pub.The Thai food used to be good but quality has gone downhill.

ihlRwiFqwzpjQd_0eifjLg.text: There is a cheer that students do at American basketball games. The cheer is called, "overrated."  It is used when a winning team plays poorly or when their performance seems to be inflated as compared to what is really happening. The Churchill Arms is a beautiful pub/ restaurant with ample flowers out front and great beer. However, the Thai food brings the rating down. Clearly, this restaurant is overrated.

szVilv71akv-nBQvgcMF-g.text: The only reason for the 2 stars is because the service is HORRIBLE. I read the reviews prior to visiting the restaurant and expected bad service, but I was not expecting outright rudeness and apathy. The only reason why I bothered to visit this restaurant is b/c I love Thai food. It was as good as the reviews say. Very good flavor, portions are plenty, price is right...but is it worth a 2nd visit and endure rude and ill mannered attitude to customers? No. It was delicious food and amazing while it lasted. Unfortunately, I'd rather spend my money elsewhere where the bad attitudes don't make me feel uncomfortable throughout my entire meal and experience. It's too bad, because also the ambiance is beautiful with potted plants hanging from the ceiling.

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Shrimp Pad Thai. Delicious!
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. Red Curry. This has 3 spicy rating. I had thought it was London standard spicy=mild. But it is HOT!Caution on the extra hot dish
Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom

ezZGFlK3FwXADU8qGeuMVw.text: I am biased, been coming here for 15 years. Great, great pub. A Sunday afternoon / evening favourite. Nice log fire, great ambience with the Churchill memorabilia and the Thai restaurant out the back is a firm favourite. Simple food, not gourmet, but large portions and £8.50 a dish is a winner. Book in advance always, make sure you sit in the indoor garden out the back. Just a lovely laid back vibe in the heart of London. Alan Titmarsh was hear two months ago to see the indoor garden so that must be a thumbs up from him as well !

photos.caption: Photo of The Churchill Arms - London, United Kingdom. The dining room

U9oK6dOsiMeS04KhgfhtqA.text: Cue Natalie Imbruglia: NOTHING'S RIGHT, I'M TORN!So: top marks for kitsch and environment.  I have always admired The Churchill Arms from the outside - flowers galore!  Prime Kensington Church Street corner location! - but had never ventured in.  Tonight...we went!  The pub has a lot of weird stuff (I know, I know, that's a general term, but still: applicable) hanging from the ceiling, and through to the back is a Thai restaurant.  Thai you say?  Yes!  Even better, though: an amazing display of hanging plants, flower pots and lit candles all around the dining room.  It's like a magical conservatory with SE Asian flair!Marks knocked because: the Thai food was fine (hot fried vegetarian spring rolls were crispy, the veggie 'sweet and sour' stir fry was a little "gloopy" but totally fine, and my favourite part of the pad thai were the plump prawns that were part of the "mixed" option including shellfish, chicken and pork).  BUT, that said: the service was extremely rushed.  We felt forced into our choices, forced to finish, and then were told (though this was never indicated when we sat down) that we had to "finish up" because they "needed the table".  My *major* pet peeve was in the case of the bill / tip, though: because there were two of us paying (both cash) and we only had big bills, we put in over 50% of the final bill.  The server took our money tray away and...never returned.  When we caught him (long wait), he said he assumed that was our gratuity.  An assumed 50% tip?  Especially given the totally rushed nature of the meal and how we felt like we were being moved along at every course...that bold assumption just rubbed us both the wrong way, and I ended up feeling like a schmuck asking for some of the change back.  Meh meh.  Yelp note: come for the beer and the flowers, maybe pass on the full meal?  Just a thought.

8oPYufpZlXpTquoQV5RWWw.text: Great Thai food and wonderful ambiance. Get there early, put your name in and have a couple brews at the bar. There is so much history at this place , you'll find yourself talking for hours! Great location

flT1-kpf8x4B8q-48XU67g.text: Such a great looking place from outside. Haven't seen anything like it ever before. In terms of food it was okay. Nothing too crazy, but value for money was good. The bar is what makes this place very, very good. Service is great, prices are great, and atmosphere is great.

zICn7twCUIee6kRz6fxpYg.text: Really cool concept. The Penang curry was delicious. Pad Thai was okay---would order something different next time (and all other dishes around us looked great as well). Generous portions. We watched the euros here and had a good experience--- plenty of screens. Good service. Would come back!

YvXxr9noAupJEHoEEx6zgQ.text: Very impressive pub, both exterior and interior. And their Guinness is always fresh.Overly crowded and boozy most of the times, which is part of experience.Enjoyable local crowd and quite many tourists at all time.And they have a lovely Thai restaurant in the extension on the right hand side, which is both cheap and tasty.

2BCyT18cc77BhshByVvuSA.text: A waitress came and interrupted our conversation with her presence, pointed twice to her "not there watch" and left without saying a word. I was a bit shocked, to be honest, I have never seen anything like this before. Apparently you are only allowed to have the table for one hour and we were taking a bit longer... shame on us! Enjoying our diner!Apart from that, the food is great and (most of) the waitresses are nice. The decoration is great: pub and thai part! I did not know it was really common to have Asiatic restaurants in the pubs and I loved the idea.I must confess I am thinking in the panang curry I had and I would love to be there right now!
